112.content:
Last night, there was a strange dream that turned and twisted in abstract and grotesque imagery. Celestial bodies hung in a cosmic abyss which stretched its tendrils towards the shapeless masses and used its alchemy to create; pieces broke off and reformed into fantastic structures, rock was pulled and stretched into tall spires, and color pulsed into the dark cracks and sometimes dripped from above to weave welcoming curtains.

But bright light shined from an entrance to a building passing by and ceased all movement. White streaks flared outward in a brilliant explosion that breached the reaches of all vision, and within its center life stirred. It could not be seen, save for the slightest ripple of energy that shook this universe, but its eyes could be sensed, the watcher's gaze gripping the listener's heart.

And it spoke...
112.title: The Eyes and the Mind

You are quite excited today!

Today is the day you can have a rightful claim over another person's life.By person, you mean a furry creature. It's funny how history has repeat itself. Discover a new species of living organisms similar to the dominant species, first order of business is to ENSLAVE THEM!

However, this time around, the government has set a few rules that try to maintain the life cycle of each and every species of slaves they could find.For one, you need a registered slave owning license, which you have in your pocket, packed nice and firmly.After that, you can own your very own slave, through auctions or through pet-like stores, or you can even adopt one if you wish. If you do own a slave, you must have him or her on a leash when you travel, or else they could be considered astray, and can be legally taken away from you.Lastly, you can do anything with your slave! Feed them, pet them, put them to labor, or even have sex with them.

You really hope it's the last one.

Yes, you are indeed a 22 year old man, who's been feeling quite lonesome after leaving the house, and being on your own, in a apartment.You're not exactly the most brute person out there, but you certainly have more brains than brawn. Hell, you finished high school being in one of the top 5 students in the county! Top that, Einstein!

But that's why you are excited! Today, at a local library, they are holding a auction. This auction has proclaimed that this is unlike any other.You're pretty sure that was an attention grabber, but who cares when you can own a furry for 3 dollars?Seriously, someone has offered 3 dollars for a ant anthropomorphic being, and that person won!You hope your luck is as high as ever, as you want to be able to get the lowest price for anybody, or anything really.

After a decent walk down to the local library, you instantly see signs that show where the auctions are being held, which is commonly pointing to the left. After following the signs, there was a door with a label saying "Auctions being held! Please keep quiet!"

Ironic ain't it?

You entered the door to see a crowd of people all who are sitting in chairs, possibly all bidders, but some are more than likely to just watch. You head towards the crowd, but then you right foot hit a small basket with signs, each labeled with numbers.Your hit was loud enough to have a few people turn back at you then back to the auctioneer. You felt slightly embarrassed. You quickly grabbed a random sign, ironically numbered 69, and head into a random chair,in the back.

"And sold to the beautiful lady in the white dress!" A voice said, most likely the auctioneer. A few round of claps before the antelope anthro was carried off by a leash. You didn't know who exactly was holding the leash, but that didn't matter to you. Right now, the only thing that matters is you getting someone to take home with you, and possibly getting physically intimate.

"Next on the list is a special little bugger. Will my associates please bring it up!?"

11331.content:
Mary the Feline


“Next up, we have this stunning young feline!”

Damn it.

You rolled your eyes as a naked, twenty-something anthro is literally shoved onstage. She appeared to be some kind of cat, with fur that -- though once beautifully, vibrantly grey -- was now dirty and mangy from neglect. She kneeled there, staring at the floor in front of her, trying desperately to avoid eye contact with the crowd.

You were attending, somewhere on the fringes of society, an underground auction where a shady organization comes to pawn off various dubiously-gained goods. The details weren’t really important. You only cared about the whole business because you could occasionally nab valuable baubles at half the normal price. But over the years, these auctions have been rapidly declining in quality. Most annoying was the occasional sale of ‘anthros’. Anthros are bizarre, artificially created hybrids of humans and animals that started popping up a few years ago. While nobody knew what to do with them at first, when the courts ruled that anthros weren’t protected by human rights, they started garnering interest as exotic pets, servants, and even -- you shudder to think -- ‘toys’. You personally found the trade of anthros to be distasteful, at best, and you certainly had no interest in buying one.

“The bidding will start at seventy-five hundred dollars! The seller won’t take anything less than seventy-five hundred dollars,” The auctioneer announces. Though she was apparently extremely cheap for an anthro, you still weren’t at all interested. You resolved to just ignore her altogether, and wait for the next item to be brought up. Though as you sat there, you noticed something strange about the feline. While most anthros that were sold at this auction seemed enthusiastic and excited to be sold, she looked miserable, as if she was on the verge of tears. Though you usually didn’t like anthros, you couldn’t help but feel sorry for the poor feline. You felt nauseous when it struck you how much she reminded you of Mary -- a cat you grew up with as a child. But you couldn’t let nostalgia cloud your judgement. You weren’t prepared to own an anthro. Where would you even keep her?

“Oh, wait! I have a note here from the seller...” the auctioneer pauses, obviously having not prepared at all beforehand. “Ah, it looks like this beauty is a limited-time offer! If she isn’t sold today, she’ll be put down, so buy her fast!” Though she was turned away from you, you noticed the feline visibly shudder as he spoke that line. You reacted too, your fingers clenching around the arms of your chair in surprise. What the hell? Since she was a pet, legally, she could be ‘put down’, but… they wouldn’t, would they? As far as you were aware, anthros were sapient, and maybe even as intelligent as humans. Now you understood why the poor girl looked so miserable. “Seventy-five hundred dollars. I want seventy-five hundred dollars...” You held your breath as the auctioneer called for bids among the completely silent crowd. Most preferred enthusiastic and submissive anthros; nobody wanted to buy an anthro that looked so miserable. You silently prayed that someone would buy her. You had no interest in purchasing her yourself, but… you couldn’t just let her die, right? Everyone else seemed completely apathetic to the feline’s fate. After a while, the auctioneer paused, seeming on the verge of giving up. This may be your last chance.

“I’ll consider this my good deed for this month,” you mutter quietly to yourself, before holding up a finger, calling the auctioneer’s attention. “Fuck it! Seventy-five hundred dollars!” You declare on impulse.

“Sold for seventy-five hundred dollars!” The auctioneer’s face lit up, as he didn’t even bother trying to fish for bids any longer. You lean back in your chair as the feline is dragged offstage. What have you gotten yourself into?

As you sat there and despaired, the auction continued. “And our next item is...”

-----


After the auction, you stopped to pay for and retrieve the things you bid for. You did manage to nab a few small trinkets, but ultimately, you blew most of your money on the anthro. “Hey, about that anthro...” you stop to ask. “I know I bought her and all, but is there any chance I could just let her go? Let her run off and be free? I don’t really want to keep her.”

“It’s possible, I suppose. But legally, anthros are considered pets, and cannot be left to roam the streets unattended,” is the only answer you receive. “Sorry, sir.”

“Alright...” You sigh. “Bring her up.” The young anthro is presented before you, which let you finally see her in closer detail. This was one of the first few times you had seen an anthro this close before, in fact. You were struck by how much she resembled a normal human, with only a few nagging differences. She looked very surreal, almost as if you were staring into the uncanny valley. Being completely naked and having been obviously genetically engineered to have a physique more befitting a supermodel or a porn star than a maid, it was obvious she had been created with one ‘purpose’ in mind. However, you personally had no interest in that kind of thing, and honestly found it kind of disgusting. Additionally, you noticed a few scars along her back and sides, and other general signs of neglect and abuse. Apparently this feline had had a rough lot in life.

All the while, she stared at the ground, completely silent, trying not to make eye contact. You had expected her to be excited and grateful -- you had just saved her life, after all -- but instead, she looked almost… disappointed. Since this was your first anthro, you were briefed on the basics of anthro care. They also offered you a leash to lead her around with, but you declined. Had to let the poor girl keep some dignity. Instead, when you were all finished, you let her walk out by your side, leaning her head on your shoulder weakly. You hurried back to your car as fast as you could, definitely not wanting to be seen in public with a naked anthro chick.

As you started on the long drive home, you let her lay down in the backseat, mostly because she looks like she hadn’t rested in days. She still hadn’t said anything, and was facing the other direction from you. She probably assumed you were some kind of pervert. After about a half hour, you decide to break the silence. “So… you’ve got a name, right?” You say, expecting some kind of response, but she just remained silence. After a few minutes, you reached back and tried to get her attention. “Eh?”

“You should’ve just left me there...” was the first thing she said, sounding like she was on the verge of tears. You grimaced. Oh boy. This might turn out to be even harder than you expected. She does know they would’ve killed her if you hadn’t bought her, right? Maybe she didn’t care.

“Yeah, maybe I should’ve. But I didn’t,” you say, a bit more assertively. “So I’m sorry, but you’re gonna have to put up with me. And it would help if you told me your name.”

She was silent for a while. “I don’t have a name,” she answered simply, as if it was completely normal. You recall reading online that many anthros that were created to be slaves weren’t given names, to further deter any sense of individuality.

“Well, that’s just inconvenient. I have to call you something,” you say. “If you could have any name you wanted, what would it be?”

She just looks confused and frustrated for a few minutes, like she wasn’t really interested in the question, before suddenly having a change of heart as inspiration strikes. “Mary,” she says. “I think I’d want to be called… Mary.” Your heart leaps, and your grip on the steering wheel tightens. Mary… as you mentioned before, that had been the name of your beloved childhood pet. Did she know? After pondering this for a while, you decide it must be just a coincidence.

“Mary’s a fine name,” you finally reply. You couldn’t think of anything else to say, and she seemed like the quiet type anyway, so you spent the next couple hours in silence.
11331.title: Reluctant Cat Owner

choices: She comes out a few hours later.
113311.content:
Eventually, you arrive at your humble two-story apartment.

You pull open the car door, only to find that mary was sound asleep, and had been for most of the drive. It made sense, you suppose; she didn’t look like she gets much rest. You try shaking her awake, but realize she’s a remarkably deep sleeper. You also realize how incredibly light she was; probably because feline anthros are created with agility and climbing ability prioritized, similarly to real cats. Ultimately, you shrugged and decided to just let her sleep, instead picking her furry body up in your arms and carrying her inside. This earned you a few funny looks from your neighbors.

You plop her down on your couch, which still doesn’t rouse her from her slumber. While you usually found anthros to be disturbing, you had to admit, she looked pretty cute lying there. You took a moment to consider what you were going to do with her in the long-term. You had already decided that you were going to try and give her away as soon as you find a good home for her, but in the meantime, you decided to set up the guest bedroom for her to stay in. By the time you finished, Mary was sitting up lazily on the couch, stretching and yawning. “Rise and shine,” you greet. “Welcome to your new home, I guess.”

“My… home?” she repeats. She seemed to be constantly confused by how you treat her. Judging from her scars, her previous owner must’ve been a sick bastard, so she was probably used to being treated cruelly. She obviously didn’t expect you to be very kind, and still didn’t completely trust you.

“Well, it’s my apartment, so yeah,” you reply. You grimaced when you noticed some of the dirt and grime on her fur had stained the couch. “I’d let you look around, but I think it’d be best if you washed off first.” You walk off, gesturing for her to follow you. She pauses, distrusting, before reluctantly trailing after you. Even though she’s fairly tall, you notice that she’s so thin and lightweight that her footsteps were completely silent. You lead her upstairs to your largest bathroom, pointing towards your shower. In response, however, she only stares at you blankly, confused. “... you do know how a shower works, right?” She suddenly avoids eye contact, looking flustered and embarrassed. You sigh in frustration. “No? Really? How do you even bathe?”

“My old master used to just hose me down every once in awhile...” Mary admits, the humiliation apparent in her voice. Wow, you think. Getting her settled in is going to be harder than I thought... well, I guess that isn't her fault.

“Uh… well, this is kind of like that,” you say, trying not to make her feel any more embarrassed than she was already. You fiddle around with the knobs for a moment, getting some warm water going. “Just go ahead and step in,” you direct. She hesitates, obviously terrified of the water, probably expecting it to be freezing cold. Her face immediately brightens, however, when she finally worked up the courage to step inside the shower, and felt the clear water flow over her naked body.

“Wow! The water’s so warm,” she laughed, amazed. You realized that since she was used to being bathed via hose, she’s probably never had a nice, warm, relaxing shower before. While you still weren’t a big fan of anthros, it was admittedly rather heartwarming to watch her get so excited over something so simple. You heard there was a ton of bathing supplies made specifically for anthros, but you didn’t have anything like that, so you figured normal soap would have to do.

-----

While she was busy in the shower, you sat in the next room on your phone, looking for anthro shelters in the area. Eventually, you hear her messing with the knobs, followed by the sound of the shower shutting off. At least she learns quickly, you think to yourself. You walk in just as she was stepping out of the shower, tossing her a towel. While she dried off, you noticed she looked completely different while wet, her fur becoming shiny and slick, clinging to her skin. You noticed that her disposition had also changed; instead of being reserved and confused, she was starting to act a bit giddy and excited. While she dried off, you dug around for something for her to wear. You didn’t want her walking around naked all the time, after all. Unfortunately, you didn’t have anything close to her size. “Here, wear this,” you say, tossing her a t-shirt you decided on.

She quickly slips it on, looking eager to finally have some clothing. It was almost comically oversized, but at least it offered her some modesty, as well as making her look absolutely adorable. As you had come to expect, even the simple old, cheap, itchy t-shirt got her excited. “Thank you so much, master!” You cringe at the word.

“Please. Call me Jim,” you insist, calmly. “Now, you want me to show you around? I’ve got a spare bedroom downstairs.” You show her your guest bedroom, which you’d been previously been using as nothing but a storage area. You watched as she plopped down on her new bed, inspecting it. The bed was a bit small and uncomfortable, but with her low standards, you really doubt she minded. You expected her to be beaming at this point, but when you turned to her, to your surprise, you noticed a few tears rolling down her face. “Is something the matter?” you raise a brow.

“N-no… it’s just...” she says, wiping the tears from her face, as she tried to compose herself. Despite her crying, she can’t seem to wipe the smile off her face as she leaned back in bed. “I always dreamed of living like this. Clothes, a room, a shower. I… I thought they were going to kill me first! I thought my whole life was just to be tortured and played with like some kind of… toy.” She cried, finally confiding in you. “But you… but you’re…”

You sat down next to her on the bed, and let her rest her head on your shoulder as she cried. You shifted awkwardly, not sure what to say exactly. You were no therapist. “Jesus, lady. It’s nothing, really.” You sat in silence for a bit while she sobbed, as it dawned on her how glad she was to be alive. You didn’t really care about her at first, but now, you couldn’t help but sympathize with her.

When she regained her composure, you stood up and left her to her own devices. “Well, you should get some rest. You need it,” you say. “I’ll be in the living room if you need me.” With that said, you crash on the couch. It had been a long day, and you wanted to take a few moments to contemplate everything that’s happened.
113311.title: Washing Away the Past

1133111.content:
To your surprise, it was about midnight when Mary stumbled into the living room, rubbing the sleep from her eyes. “You're up late,” you noted. After looking so exhausted all day, you figured she would've wanted to get more rest.

“I... I couldn't sleep,” she said, dismissively, but you could tell from the redness of her eyes that she probably had a pretty serious nightmare. It occurs to you that she was probably suffering some sort of PTSD from all that's happened to her. You were just planning on hitting the hay, but decide you should at least do something to make her feel better. You couldn’t just leave her here to cry.

“That's fine,” you reassure her. She stands awkwardly in your living room, looking distinctly out-of-place. “Hey, you know what a ‘movie’ is, right?”

“What? Do you have movies!?” She instantly reacted, her eyes scanning the room before landing on the shelves around your TV. She rushed over, noticing the library of movies you keep on your shelf; everything you've ever considered worth keeping. She bent over to sort through your collection, which resulted in her inadvertently waving her big, furry rear in your face. “Oh my god! You have so many!”

“Whoa, slow down. What's wrong?” you say as you stand up, startled by her outburst. She turned to you, that bright, giddy smile on her face again. After having watched her sob, it was a heartwarming sight.

“I loved movies since I was a girl!” Mary explained, sorting through your collection. “But I pretty much never got to watch any... especially not this many.” You smiled, noticing that movies were apparently something Mary was particularly passionate about. Since she probably didn't have much experience with cinema, you grabbed a light adventure film you liked as a child, Pirates of the Pancreas. The feline's face lit up when you flicked the TV on. “Really? We're... really going to watch one?” She says, almost in disbelief. “Oh, yes! Thank you!”

While you found movie previews annoying, Mary seemed absolutely enthralled by them. While they kept her entertained, you walked off to the kitchen to microwave some popcorn. When you returned, she was curl up cutely in a blanket on the couch, so enthralled in the trailers that she hadn't even noticed you left. “What's this?” she asked, only turning her attention away from the television screen when you handed her the bowl of popcorn.

“It's called 'popcorn'. Try it,” you recommend. She curiously tried a handful of popcorn, before smiling in approval and digging in for more. She now looked like a proper cinemaphile. You weren't entirely sure if popcorn was part of an anthro's recommended diet, but whatever, it couldn't hurt too much.

You sit down on the other side of the couch just as the movie starts. Mary's eyes opened wide with wonder as scenes of grand adventure, likeable characters and exciting action flashed onscreen. You could see why she was such a big fan. When life becomes too mundane – or, in her case, too unbearable – it's always nice to escape into fiction. Though you were a little worried she might assume everything she was seeing onscreen was real. “Whoa! How did he do that?” the feline gasped after a particularly impressive action scene.

“It was probably just special effects,” you assured her. In response to her silence, you elaborated, “the animators using computers to add something to a movie that isn't actually there. They can simulate pretty much every situation.”

“So they can make a movie about... anything?” she asks, her mind racing with the possibilities.

“Well, it could get expensive, but... pretty much, yeah,” you say with a shrug, but chuckle when you see the look on her face. “Let me guess. You want to work on movies someday?” She nods without taking her eyes off the screen. “Well, it's good to have dreams.” You noticed that she was absentmindedly leaning against your side while wrapped up in her blanket, absorbed in the film onscreen. She even rubbed her cheek against your side a bit, like a real cat would.

You found it a bit disturbing, to be honest. She was so similar to a human being -- the same voice, the same body, the same mannerisms – which only made the differences more noticeable. The fur that covered her body, her massive fluffy ears, her long tail... while she seemed cute and charming at a glance, when you really think about it, it was all just unnatural. Perturbed by the feeling of her furry cheek on your shoulder, you slide over to the other side of the couch. You couldn't tell for certain, but for a moment, her expression seemed a bit... hurt.

---

Eventually, the villain was defeated, the hero proposed to the damsel, and the movie faded to black. She jumped out of her seat as the credits rolled. “What? It's over already?” she gasps.

“Well, yeah. It's been over two hours,” you reply.

“But... but their story can't be over yet! They just saved the day and got engaged!” she insists. Her tail flicks around wildly behind her, signifying her displeasure. Apparently, she wasn't aware that movies had endings. “Where do they go from there?”

“I don't know. I guess that's just left up to your imagination,” you shrug. It was a little charming seeing that she loved the storyline so much, especially since it wasn’t even particularly good. “Anyway, it’s probably a good time to hit the hay. It’s going to be a long day tomorrow.” Your decision seems to snap the feline out of her trance, and she turns to you.

“Oh, yeah. I guess it’s pretty late, huh?” she laughs, looking at the clock. “Again, thank you so much. That movie was amazing! My old master never let me have any fun like this,” she says sincerely, as she shuffles lazily back towards her new room. After she left, you checked the clock yourself. 3 AM. Fuck. You made the long, arduous journey up the stairs, towards your ultimate destination; the master bedroom. By the time your tired body landed on your bed, you were already asleep.
1133111.title: Passion for Cinema (and pirates)

11331111.content:
When you stumbled lazily downstairs the next morning, you were stunned by what you saw. Since you usually lived alone, your house was generally a complete mess, with bits of trash strewn about and various shelves left messy and unorganized. Stains were left to fester, and dust was allowed to build up. But this morning, everything looked absolutely spotless. All the surfaces in the house were thoroughly cleaned, and all your worldly possessions were organized neatly. In the middle of it all was Mary, still enthusiastically dusting cabinets while humming a jaunty little tune. “Mornin’, sleepyhead!” She briefly looked over her shoulder to greet you. Her demeanor was entirely different than it was yesterday.

“Oh, wow. Did you do all this?” you said, looking around. You noticed all your movies had been rearranged on their shelf, and were now organized alphabetically. “Everything looks spotless.”

“Well, of course!” She says. “That is part of my duty as your servant, is it not?”

“... I don't consider you a slave, you know. You don’t have to do anything for me,” you frown. You liked a clean house, but you didn’t want to feel like you were forcing her to do free labour for you. “It’d probably be better if you just relaxed.”

“Oh, no, I insist!” She says, turning to you. Her expression became a little more serious. “I mean… you saved my life, after all. And you’ve treated me nicer than anyone else ever has…” That was a sad thought, considering you weren’t even a particularly nice guy. “Besides, cleaning helps me take my mind off things.” You consider it for a while, then shrug.

“... suit yourself!” you decide, as you start preparing your routine morning coffee. If Mary really wanted to do some cleaning up around here, you certainly weren’t going to stop her. While you relaxed, you browsed around on your phone -- but this time, you weren’t looking for shelters, you were looking for therapists that specialize in helping troubled anthros. So far, you couldn’t find any. You did, however, find a few who claimed to be experts at ‘mentally breaking’ anthros. Creepy fuckers. “Oh yeah, by the way. If you’re feeling up to it, we’re going shopping later. Need to get you some grub, and hopefully a proper outfit,” you declare. “If they even make clothing for anthros…” The oversized t-shirt Mary wore was cute, but probably not too comfortable -- and because of her tail, she couldn’t wear human pants, and you didn’t want to be seen in public with her while she’s half-naked.

“Really?” Mary replied, looking curious. She pondered in her head what, hypothetically, kind of clothing she would wear, if she could have anything. She had very little frame of reference, to be honest. ‘Clothing’ had long been a foreign concept to her; she had been walking around naked for as long as she could remember. “Cool,” she says, with that familiar hint of excitement in her voice.

It was only an hour later that you found yourself starting up your car. Mary sat in the passenger seat beside you, trying to figure out how to use a seatbelt. You took a quick glance at the beautiful skyline of Fresno as you messed with your phone, trying to deduce the best place to go clothes shopping for an mutant animal-human hybrid creature. You weren’t surprised to find that there weren’t many. Not finding any info, you just try embarking on the half-hour drive to the biggest mall in the area. Maybe they’ll have something there. Maybe.

---


Apparently there really was a clothing store that catered solely to anthros. When Mary laid eyes on it, she was like a kid in a candy store. You spent almost an hour talking with various employees, who helped her pick out underwear and outfits she liked. Of course, the whole shopping spree ran you a few hundred dollars, but it definitely turned out to be worth it. By the time she walked out of the store, proudly donning her new favorite outfit, she was absolutely beaming. For the first time in her life, she was fully dressed, and no longer had to walk around naked all the time. Even over something so minor, her whole demeanor changed; her strut seemed more confident and dignified, as if to send the message that she was an equal now, and not some lowly ‘toy’ anymore.

“How do I look?” She asks, striking a quick pose, showing off her vibrant red brouse that complemented her grey fur.

“For the thousandth time: you look great,” you repeat. You couldn’t help but be struck by how different she acts now compared to how she acted when you first laid eyes on her just yesterday. Maybe a little dignity and kindness was all she needed. She certainly still had a lot to learn about the world… but then again, so do you. Satisfied, the two of you walk off to grab something to eat.

“Jiiiim! Hey buddy!” You suddenly hear a voice behind you. You turned to see a blond-haired man in a red tank top rapidly approaching. Mark. An old acquaintance of yours. You remember him as being kind of douchey, but rarely unbearable. “Shit, man, I haven’t seen you in ages. Where you been?” While you had Mary in tow, you wanted to avoid being seen by anybody you knew, but it was already too late. Mark was only a few yards away now. Once he found out you had purchased an anthro, word was going to spread quickly.

“Hey, Mark. I haven’t been up to much, just, uh…” you say, but are interrupted when Mary catches up to you and nuzzles against your side, not even having noticed that Mark was there. Upon realizing you owned her, the man immediately burst out laughing.

“Haha! You got one of those anthro fucktoys? That’s what you’ve been doing all this time? Wow…” He said, almost in disbelief. You had earned yourself a reputation as a boring, average joe, so you could see why he would be surprised. “And here I thought you were as vanilla as they come.”

“I don’t -- I’m not -- what the hell? She’s not my ‘fucktoy’!” you insist, his rashness taking you by surprise. “She just cleans up around the apartment.” Mary, also a bit startled by his tone, grabbed on to your arm.

He stares at the two of you incredulously for a few moments, sizing you up, before smirking. “Oh, I see what this is. You’re one of those bleeding heart anthro fanatics, right? Shit. Guess I shoulda figured,” he said. “You think you’re gonna ‘fix’ her, don’t you?”

“I don’t want to talk about this,” you glare.

“Hey, man, I’m not being an asshole. I’m just warning ya,” he explains. “Obviously, anthros are cute, right? You’re probably falling in love with it. But listen -- it’s an illusion, man.” He seems to drop his sarcastic demeanor, though that doesn’t make you any less defensive. “They’re programmed to be sympathetic, to convince guys like you to drop hundreds of dollars on ‘anthro fashion’ and ‘anthro cuisine’. Hell, how much did that outfit cost?” He asks, jabbing Mary in the chest with a finger.

“I don’t have time for this,” you say, not wanting to listen to his ramblings anymore, grabbing Mary by the hand and leading her away.

“See? You can’t even talk to your old pal anymore. Isolation -- that’s the first step,” Mark insists as you walk off. “She’s gonna bleed you dry!” You ignore him. You were already conflicted enough as it is; you don’t need wild conspiracy theories like that clouding your judgment. Mary remained silent as the two of you disappeared around a corner, stepping into the bustling food court. You noticed that she seemed very tense.

A few minutes later, the two of you settled down at a table. You still had no idea what anthros were supposed to eat, but you figured, since she was a cat, she probably likes meat, right? You probably had to contact some sort of anthro dietitian at some point, especially since Mary still seemed fairly malnourished from her previous neglect. For the time being, at least, she seemed satisfied with steak.

As you ate, you couldn’t help but think about what Mark had said. You know it was probably bullshit, but… you remember how expensive Mary was, and how much money you’ve already spent on ‘deluxe, anthro-approved’ products. Even the whole ‘putting her down’ thing seemed like it could’ve been a ploy for your sympathy. Could Mary really be just some sort of parrot… designed to say whatever she needs to say to play with your emotions? “What that man said, about me… none of it’s true,” Mary whispers, almost as if she had read your mind. “You know that, right?” You noticed her expression was dead serious, and her voice sounded worried.
11331111.title: Shopping Spree

113311112.content:
You’ve never really known what the think of this whole situation. To be honest, you knew absolutely jack shit about anthros, and you’ve never really liked them. Who’s to say they couldn’t read your mind -- manipulate you? I mean, it seems like an odd coincidence that Mary just so happened to choose the same name as your childhood cat had. You’re probably just being ridiculous, of course… but there’s no harm in being incredulous. “You seem a bit defensive,” you say, noticing how pale and tense she became during Mark’s ramblings. Just hearing your tone, Mary looked scared and hurt, like she knew you didn’t fully believe her.

“What? N-no, I’m not...” The feline whispered, leaning in towards you. She seemed to choose her words carefully. “I just… I don’t like it when people say things like that.”

“What? Is that an accusation you’ve heard of before?” you ask, paying careful attention to her tone and mannerisms.

There was a short pause. Her expression; unreadable. “Why do you ask?” She whispered, looking increasingly depressed as you interrogated her.

“There’s something you’re not telling me, Mary,” you declare. At this point, you almost didn’t like calling her by the name ‘Mary’ anymore.

“Master, we’re having a great day. Right? All I want to do is sit back and enjoy our time togeth-” she insists, louder this time, trying to change the subject. You noticed her call you ‘master’ again, even though you had told her not to.

“Answer the question,” you interrupt, quietly but assertively. “If you tell me the truth, I’ll believe you.”

“Okay, okay,” she relented, throwing her hands up, intimidated by your more forceful tone. She leans closer, and hesitates for a few moments. “A lot of people think anthros are… fake. Designed to manipulate people. It’s a common… theory. Becoming more common every day. It’s what my last master started to believe. That I was just an object… programmed to mess with his mind. That’s why he… why he was planning to have me killed,” she whispered, sounding dead serious. “Do you understand now? I just don’t want you to give up on me too.” She sighed, slumping back in her chair. “I’m sorry, master. I don’t like talking about this sort of thing.”

Of course, the look in her eyes was all she needed to tug on your heartstrings. You decided to put a bit of trust in her for now -- but you still resolved to do more research later. “Alright, alright. I’m sorry. Don’t worry about it,” you relented, putting a reassuring hand on her shoulder. “But stop calling me ‘master’.” Mary nodded with a smile, glad that line of questioning was over. From then, you only had a bit of small talk as the two of you finished your meal. The fast food wasn’t particularly nutritious, of course, but it sated your appetites for the time being. As you ate, you couldn’t help but notice that you were the only person with an anthro in the room, and Mary’s presence had been earning you some funny looks. You couldn’t help but feel a little embarrassed.

Meanwhile, Mary seemed to bask in the attention she got. As you walked out of the mall, she couldn’t help but wave and pose for curious passersby. As you travelled back to your car, the excitable feline in tow, you tried not to make eye contact with anyone, hoping not to be identified. “So where are we heading now?” Mary asks as she takes a seat, excited to explore more of the town.

“I actually don’t know,” you realize, as you pull out your phone. “Hold on.” You browse around for any anthro-friendly establishments. There was an anthro grooming place nearby, and an anthro store, but mostly you found places that specialized in the torture and ‘breaking’ of slaves, which you had no interest in. Eventually, you discover Fur Paradise, which boasted its services in anthro care, supplies and medical care. It seemed like a pretty nice place, though it was an extra hour’s drive away and seemed quite small. You ponder it for a while, before deciding ‘fuck it, might as well’. Perhaps you could even find the information you’ve been looking for. As you start down the (slightly) long road north to Merced, you hand your phone to Mary. “How does Fur Paradise look?” you ask.

She fiddles with your phone for a few moments, trying to figure out how it works, but she learns quickly. Her eyes light up as she looks over the details. “Whoa, this is where we’re going? Yeah, this place looks great! Maybe I could even meet other anthros there,” she speculated with wonder. You relaxed as the bored feline continued to mess around with your phone, as you watched the grey cityscape roll by.

---

An hour later, as you finally drove into the parking lot, you noticed Fur Paradise did, indeed, look promising. There were a few red flags, of course. The doors and windows look a bit damaged, with one of the windows being smashed completely, and the store was obviously quite small. Shit, it looked like a riot just stormed through the area. Mary, of course, didn’t notice any of these smaller details at all; she just rushed over and poked her head through the door, barely able to contain her excitement. On the inside, the store resembled a normal pet store, although selling more specialized food and medicine then toys. The only person you could see inside was a charming young lady, not much older than you, wearing a light purple outfit that vaguely approximated a uniform.

A bell chimed as you step inside, and the woman turned to you immediately, a smile on her face. “Oh, good afternoon!” She says, seeing Mary walk in by your side. “I assume you’re a new owner?”

“Lucky guess. Just bought her yesterday,” you nod, wrapping an arm around Mary's shoulder.

“Ah, how exciting!” she smiles, inviting you in so the two of you can make introductions. Apparently, this woman was Sally, the one who ran this store, or so the website said. She looked a lot younger than you imagined. “And what’s your name, sweetheart?” she asks, turning to your anthro.

“Mary,” the feline answered with a timid smile, not used to Sally’s outgoing nature.

“That is a beautiful name,” Sally smiles, ruffling Mary’s hair.

“Hey, uh,” Mary says, blushing a bit, “Are there any other, uh, anthr-” Suddenly, another uniformed person came rushing in from one of the side doors. You looked over, and laid your eyes on one of the most beautiful anthros you’ve ever seen! She was apparently some kind of bird, and was obviously very well taken care of; her orange feathers were shiny and vivid, and her proportions healthy and full. You’d never actually seen an avian anthro with such full wings; usually, their wings were clipped, so they couldn’t fly away. If this is really what Sally’s own anthro looked like, you and Mary were certainly in good hands.

“Hey, Sally! I just got off the phone with John about the window. He-” the bird anthro said, in a loud, deep voice, before stopping when she laid eyes on the two of you. She looked almost surprised. “Oh, hey. We’ve got some fresh faces.” The avian stopped for a moment with a sly smile, sizing you up. Mary gasped when she laid eyes on the bird. Before you could react, the feline had already burst forward, and wrapped the avian in a hug. “Whoa!”

“Oh my god! I’ve never seen another anthro up close before!” Mary beams, her timid demeanor having disappeared completely. “We need to talk!” The avian gently pushes Mary away, startled by the outburst.

“Uh… what about?” she asks, visibly uncomfortable.

“Everything!” Mary insists, before launching into a tirade of questions -- where are you from? How did you get your feathers so shiny? Can you fly? Et cetera. You and Sally laugh as you watch their conversation, with the bird desperately trying to keep up with Mary’s energy.

“That bird there. Is it yours?” you ask, deciding to make conversation while Mary was distracted.

“Rose? Yes, yes. Though I don’t call myself her ‘owner’, I consider myself her equal. After all, for a happy anthro, all you have to do is afford them the same dignity you’d give to any human being,” Sally smiles. “So! Down to business. Do you have any training or experience in dealing with anthros, before Mary?”

“Hell no,” you wave your hands. “Here’s the thing: I don’t actually really like anthros very much. Not a big fan. I just bought Mary because her previous owner was going to kill her if I didn’t.”

Sally cups a hand over her mouth. “Goodness!”

“Yeah. I'm still deciding if I'm even going to keep her,” you shrug. “But in the meantime, I’m going to need a ton of advice…”
113311112.title: Fur Paradise

1133111121.content:
While your feline, Mary, excitedly chats with the avian, you and Sally discuss the issue at hand. Apparently raising a happy anthro was actually significantly less complicated than you always imagined it being. They’re about as intelligent as humans, or so Sally claims, and thus don’t require any training like a normal animal would. She also emphasized the importance of treating Mary as an equal, and not in the condescending manner most people treat their pets. You try to take her advice to heart. As for the feline’s diet, well, it’s about what you expected. Just like real cats, Mary was an obligate carnivore, and subsisted almost entirely on meat. Sally said that Mary looks a bit too skinny as a result of her previous owner’s neglect, but reassured you that she would regain that weight in due time, given she eats well. “So, what’s with the window?” you say, changing the subject for a moment, pointing towards the shattered window.

“Oh, please! Excuse the mess around here. We’re working on it,” Sally laughed, uncomfortably. “You know how it is. It’s kind of tough running a business like this.”

“How so?” you ask.

Sally stared at you blankly for a few moments, as if confused. “Are you… not aware of...?” she was about to ask, before stopping herself. “You… you really are new to this, huh?” She staring at her feet for a while, as if considering her words carefully. “Well, then, I think you should know… people like us, who are friendly to anthros. Y’know, ‘anthro fanatics’. It’s not exactly a, uh, popular position to take,” she explains. “I don’t know if you noticed, but these days, almost everyone in this country hates anthros. Like, more than ninety percent of people. Most people want them all dead. Others think they should all be abused and treated as slaves.” She sighs. “I do my best to help anthros, but in a society like this, well…”

You take a moment to register her words. “So… you’re saying someone smashed your windows in, just because of you like anthros?” you guess. “That’s terrible.”

“That’s nothing,” Sally shrugged. “This store’s been through a lot of shit. It’s had break-ins, robberies, vandalism… someone even tried to burn it to the ground a few years ago.”

“Jesus. I didn’t realize it was that serious,” you say. At first, you just feel sympathy… but soon, that turns to fear. You own an anthro now. Were you going to receive the same treatment? Were people going to break into your apartment at night, or assault you on the street? You liked Mary, but… you weren’t sure if you were willing to go through all that just to help her. Maybe you should just give her away, and put this whole thing behind you. However, you suddenly remember something that might make that decision easier for you. That conspiracy theory! If anyone would know the truth, it’d be Sally, even if she might be a bit biased. “I, uh… I heard that anthros are just… ‘programmed’ to act the way they do. To manipulate people,” you ask. “Is there any truth to that?”

“Ugh,” she groans. You could tell she’s heard that question before. “If you really want to know the grim truth, here it is: anthros like Mary are indeed artificially programmed to tend towards certain personality archetypes and mannerisms, to come off as ‘cute’ or ‘sexy’,” Sally explains, and for a moment, your heart sinks. “But she’s not an unthinking, unfeeling parrot. The emotions she’s feeling, and the thoughts she’s having, are genuine, just like yours or mine. She’s just wired a bit differently. Do you understand?”

You’re honestly confused. “Uh, no. I can’t say I do,” you admit. “You’re saying she is, indeed, programmed to act a certain way, but… she has her own personality?”

“Think of it like this: humans are also programmed to act a certain way. We’re genetically wired to want to breed and survive and use tools, and to find some things happy, and some things sad, and some things funny, et cetera. You know what I’m saying?” she explains in more detail. “Because our biological drive is to survive, reproduce and survive. An anthro’s biological drive is to seem cute and charming, and to please their owners.” She leans back. “They’re just like us, but their psyche a little bit different. Do you understand now?”

“Yeah, I think I do,” you nod. So Mary was actually programmed to seem cute, but she’s still... sentient? You weren’t sure if that revelation made you more or less comfortable. “So, uh… this might be a stupid question, but can she read my mind?”

Sally’s serious demeanor was dropped immediately, and she burst out laughing. “No, Mr. Garcia. She cannot,” she says. “Though like any animal, she might be particularly perceptive of your emotions. More than you might think.”

Mary returns, her arm wrapped around the avian’s shoulder. “Master, meet Rose! She’s the first anthro I’ve met in a decade!” she says, excitedly, introducing you to the uncomfortable-looking bird. “Did you know that she has a job? A real job! That she gets paid for!” This is the first time you’ve seen someone so excited over the concept of a job since college. You guess, for someone who was used to being a slave, the simple idea of ‘getting paid’ was probably refreshing.

The avian, ‘Rose’, wriggles out of Mary’s grip, and shakes your hand. It was a bit awkward trying to shake the hand of someone who only had talons, but you managed. “Nice to meet ya, sir,” she smiled. “Your feline’s a bit of an handful, isn’t she?”

“To say the least,” you chuckle. “Though it's nice to see her dote on someone else for a change.” Now that you have a good look at her, you would say Rose appeared to be some sort of turkey. She was almost taller than you were, and definitely had a lot more meat on her bones than Mary does, though not an unhealthy amount. Her breasts, you were ashamed to notice, were huge, far bigger than any human being could handle. “Now, Mary, why don’t we take a look around?”

“I would be happy to show you around if you want. It’s always nice to see new blood in this little subculture,” the turkey offered, and you nodded. “Oh yeah, and Sally, John wants to have a word with you. You can go back and call him -- I can handle this.” As Sally disappeared into a back room, Rose showed you around the store, explaining Mary’s health in further detail, discussing the pros and cons of various food products and explaining various supplements. Apparently, an anthro’s digestive system is surprisingly different from a human’s.

After a while, you get a bit tired of this subject. To be honest, you were still a bit more concerned with the whole ‘robbery and vandalism’ thing Sally mentioned earlier. “How does a store this unpopular make due?” You ask.

“Well, sometimes slaver owners, after accidentally beating their anthros a little too hard, will bring them here for a bit of medical treatment,” the turkey sighed. “But mostly we profit off a small group of very dedicated customers. In this region, anthro supporters are a tight-knit community.”

“So do you get to meet other anthros often, then?” Mary asks, inquisitively.

“Oh, all the time,” Rose smiled. “Hang around here enough, and you’re bound to meet a new face sooner than later.” As you continue browsing, Mary suddenly finds something that strikes her fancy. Before you know it, she’s waving a small, transparent bottle in your face, full of a green mixture.

“Look! Catnip!” Mary says, excited. “Oh, back when I was younger, catnip was my favorite thing in the world!” You grabbed the bottle of catnip, examining it for a few moments. It cost basically nothing. “Can we buy it? I’ll make it up to you, I swear!”

“Catnip? You sure that’s a good idea?” Rose raised a brow. “Darling, I think more energy is the last thing you need.” You consider it for a moment. Giving Mary catnip probably wasn’t a good idea in any respect whatsoever, but part of you wanted to see what would happen...
1133111121.title: Serious Matters

choices: It's about time to go home.
11331111211.content:
“Alright, alright. I’ve got to see this,” you agree. What could a few extra dollars hurt? “But we’re not opening it until we get home. I wouldn’t want make this store an even bigger mess.” She thanks you graciously, clutching the bottle against her chest as if protecting it. While Mary was distracted excitedly wandering the store, Rose pulled you aside.

“I was listening to your conversation with Sally,” the turkey notes, staring into your eyes. Her eyes were large and deeply orange. You couldn’t decide if her avian features were endearing, or unnerving. “‘Mary’ there is looking pretty good after what she’s been through.”

“Oh, uh… yeah. She recovered really quickly,” you nod. It sounded like she was complimenting you, but you also felt like she was serious about something. Her feathery hand felt a little weird and itchy gripping your arm.

“It seems like you’ve helped her a lot,” she says, “but whenever you’re around her, you just seem uncomfortable. Is there something wrong?”

How did she notice that? Apparently, she was a lot more observant than she seemed. “Oh. It’s nothing. I just… find her a bit unnerving,” you whisper. You felt a little guilty talking about Mary behind her back so much, but you really didn’t want to put her through any more stress then she's already gone through. “She’s cute, I guess, but it’s obvious she was designed to look that way. She looks halfway between real and fake, you know? It doesn’t help that I’ve always kind of hated anthros.”

Rose immediately looks a bit taken aback and offended. “Oh,” she says, her face sour.

“No, I’m so sorry! I didn’t really mean that,” you apologize upon realizing what you just said. “I guess I’m still a little prejudiced. Until I met Mary, I didn’t even know anthros were sapient. But when they said they were going to kill her, and I saw the look on her face, I guess… I knew I couldn’t let that happen. That’s why I bought her.” You remember what Mary was look when you first saw her. When you ponder how much Mary has changed so far, you realize how much she’s changed you in return. When you’re around Mary, you feel a little more happy, and a little less cynical. “I’m really sorry. I guess I don’t really know much about the whole, uh… ‘anthro rights’ situation.”

“Eh, it’s fine. You should probably keep it that way, in fact. Ignorance is bliss,” she shrugs it off, relaxing again. “It’s not like there’s anything we can do about it if we tried.”

“Is it really that bad?” you ask.

The turkey stared at the ground, her voice low. “I’ve have gotten some abuse, but I’ve been lucky. It’s not like what the ‘slaves’ go through,” she says. “Anthro slaves come through here sometimes for medical treatment. Most are being beaten by their masters. Violated. Brainwashed.” She sighs. “There’s nothing I can do for them other than fix them up and offer them some kind words. I always feel so helpless.”

“And… all that is legal?” you ask, a bit shocked.

“Yep,” she admits. “First thing you’ll learn is that pretty much nobody gives a shit about anthros anymore. Most people wish we would just go extinct so they can be done with us.”

“How… awful,” you reply, not knowing what to say. You always found anthros creepy, but you don’t understand why anybody would hate them, or try to hurt them.

“I don’t like telling you all this,” she explains, her voice now a bit angry and assertive. “But I know what you’re thinking. You’re planning on auctioning Mary off at the first opportunity. And I just wanted to know that if you do that, you’ll be dealing her a death sentence.” She glances at the feline, the two of you noticing how cheerful and innocent Mary seemed. “She’ll be bought up by some sadist who’ll do things to her you can’t even imagine for the rest of her life. You understand?”

You’re at a loss of words for a few moments. You didn’t expect the turkey to come at you in such an accusatory way. You couldn’t say she was wrong, though. You hadn’t really decided what you were going to do with Mary, but you knew that putting her up at the option was a bad idea.

When she was a slave, tied up on stage, she was submissive, quiet, miserable.

Now that she was given some freedom and dignity, she was cheerful and excitable, finally able to break out of her shell and show her real personality.

You couldn’t take that away from her.

“Yeah. I get it,” you nod, simply, and that was it. Both of you knew the conversation was over.

“Good on ya,” she says, relaxing a bit, patting your shoulder. “Now I’d like to give Mary a ‘pep talk’ too, if ya don’t mind.”

“By all means,” you confirm, even though it was obvious she didn’t actually need your permission. Rose walked off, leaving you quietly standing in the store, contemplating what she had said for a while.
11331111211.title: Rose Confronts You!

11332.content:
The main character in this story is an eastern European man named Zakhar, although everybody just called him Zak. He's around 28 years old, wears tracksuits everywhere, smokes and drinks too much, and is involved in shady businesses like buying and selling slaves. He has no job because he broke his own leg and made it look like an accident, and gets disability checks from the government... which he spends on tracksuits, cigarettes, and beer. Zak has far too much time on his hands. So, Zak has no real morals and isn't too smart. He's also got a real sadistic streak.

One day, Zakhar decided he wanted to go buy a slave. He'd helped his slaver friends move boxes full of animal-people and crates of tinies in his handicap-van before, but he'd never thought to buy one. Zak hobbled on into the slave pens to look around, where he was met by his buddy, Slavebroker Nick.
"Ah, Zak! What brings you here? Thinking about buying a slave?" Nick said.
Zak nodded.
"Sure am! What you got for me?" He asked.
"I don't know, how much you got?" Nick said.
Zak got out his wallet and showed Nick his disability check, which was enough to buy most slaves Nick had available.
"Ooh, spending your beer money here today?" Nick said.
"Yes, I'm trying to cut down beer so I don't get fat." Zak said.
"Well, you can get most any slave you want here, Zak my boy. Have a look around." Nick said.

Zak hobbled around the pens. All around him were animal-people called anthros, sitting in cages. Most were either nude or wore only tattered scraps of clothing. There were also terrariums full of tiny people, only a few inches tall about the size of a small action figure. They were in a semi-natural habitat and wore scraps and rags like loincloths, almost like a little tribe.

One thing that caught Zak's eye was a horse-girl, a girl with horse-like features like hooves and ears. Zak wanted to take her home and torment her... but he also saw a box full of naked tiny women, and those might be fun to torment too.

Which does Zak pick?
11332.title: Zak buys a slave

113322.content:
Zak found a box containing 3 tiny women that caught his eye. They were about the size of a small action figure, a few inches in height. All three of them were quite skinny and rather frightened.
"Oh, these girls are cute. Can you tell me about them?" Zak said.
Slavebroker Nick laughed.
"Oh these three! they are inseparable friends! Let me tell you." Nick said.
He picked up one, a shy, long-haired blonde girl completely naked, her hair covering her petite breasts. She was a little bit smaller and scrawnier than the other two.
"This is Anna, she is shy and cute, very adorable! The other girls tend to boss her around and take her things, that is why she is naked. That is also why I put her with the two nicest girls." Slavebroker Nick said.
He set Anna back down and lifted up a second girl. The second girl wore a red thong and matching red bra. She had thick black hair that went down to her shoulders.
"This is Lynette. She is friendly and likes to serve her master. Right, little one?" Nick said.
Lynette smiled up at him.
"Please treat me nice..." The small girl said, nervously.
Nick laughed again and set her back down. Finally, he picked up a third girl, a short haired blonde wearing a black thong and red skirt. She made no effort to hide her breasts, which were a bit larger than her two friends. She stood proudly.
"And finally, this is proud little Nikita. She thinks she is best slave on market but she is just a koo-koo hussy! Ha ha!" Nick said.
"Hey! I am no hussy!" Nikita snapped.
Zak smiled.
They are perfect. I will buy them!" He exclaimed, handing Slavebroker Nick his cash.
"Pleasure to do business, Zakhar. Come back anytime!" Nick said.

Zak quickly carried the small box of tiny women back to his place. The box, in addition to the girls, contained a small bed, some tiny-sized food, and some other things like hair brushes and a litter box. Yes, a litter box.
"Oi, what was Nick thinking? Tiny humans don't use litter box like cats!" Zak said.
He decided to get the girls cleaned up first before he did anything else with them. He set the box down near his kitchen sink and started filling up the basin with warm water.
"Tiny girls! I give you bath! Remove your scrap clothes and get in the sink!" Zak commanded.
Nikita and Lynette removed what little clothing they had while Anna nervously made her way into the water.
"Oh... this feels good!" Anna said.

How does Zak treat the girls in the sink-bath?
113322.title: Box of tinies

choices: Feed the girls some scraps from the fridge
Give the girls weapons and make them hunt the rats in his apartment
1133221.content:
Zakhar wanted to be nice to them, at least at first. He got out a small paintbrush and some dish soap. He poured a bit into the sink basin and got a bit on the brush too. He set about gently scrubbing his tiny slave girls. He started with Anna, gently washing her back and her long hair.
"Oh, that feels so good!" The Tiny squeaked.
Lynette noticed the smaller girl getting more attention and quickly pushed Anna away.
"Wash me! Wash me!" Nikita said.
She shoved the smaller, weaker Anna down and the long-haired blonde fell down into the waist-deep water with a splash. Zak laughed at her, "what a clumsy and pathetic girl!" He thought.
Anna stayed down, about up to her neck in soapy water, looking sad and a little humiliated as her master washed the slightly taller and stronger Nikita. You extended a finger for her to grab onto and lift herself up.
"Oh, do not pout, little woman. I will wash you too." Zak said, resuming using the brush on Anna.
Anna felt slightly better, but only a little. She was still a feeling somewhat betrayed that Nikita would shove her around like that. Anna thought they were friends and the moment they got a master she pushes her around.

Zak washed up his three slave girls diligently, giving each one a thorough cleaning all over their bodies and washing their hair well too. One they were all finished, he gave them some wash rags, comically oversized for the girls, to dry off with. They got back into their meager clothing, Lynette into her bra and saucy panties, Nikita into her panties and skirt, and Anna remaining nude. Anna tried to keep her washcloth at first and cover herself with that, but Zak would have none of it.
"No! Give me washcloth now! You stay naked, little woman! That washcloth needs to go in dirty laundry basket.!" Zak growled.
Timidly, Anna gave it right up and stayed exposed. She was so jealous of the other two girls, getting have clothes. Zak noticed how frustrated the naked girl was and patted her head with two fingers.
"Do not fret, tiny woman Anna. I will buy you some girlie-doll panties next time I go to toy store." He said.
"R... really?" Anna said.
"Sure, why not? They will be cute and pink and if the other two tiny women steal them from you I will punish them." Zak said, smiling.
"You really would? Thank you, master! That means so much to me!" Anna said.

What does Zak do next?
1133221.title: Zak is kind and gentle

choices: Push deeper into the rat hole
Bring their first kill back to Zakhar
11332212.content:
"Now, little naked women, I tell you all why I bought you as my slaves. My apartment has rat problem. They make holes in walls and steal food and shit on floor. Your job, tiny slave girls, is to hunt and kill rats." Zak said.
Lynette gasped and Anna quivered in fear, while Nikita haughtily laughed.
"Wouldn't it make more sense to have a cat for this?" Anna said, almost cowering in fear.
Zak laughed.
"Cats are stupid animals, little slave girls are smart. Besides, cats cannot use this!" Zak said, getting out a small box.
Inside the small box were several Tiny-Sized machine guns, AK-47 Micros as they were known. They were specially made for Tinies for protecting themselves against predators. The bullets couldn't really harm humans, being so small they could only give a man a splinter at most, but against rats and other vermin they were quite potent.
"You hunt rats with guns. You are tiny slave-soldiers now! My slave-soldiers!" Zak said.
"Bring it on! I will make them all dead!" Nikita boasted.
Zak smiled.
"You, I like you!"
She picked up the gun and quickly figured out how to hold it. Lynette had some trouble figuring it out and Anna had could barely lift the metal weapon.
"Oof! Guns are heavy!" Anna whined.

Zak quickly explained how to shoot, how to use the sights, and how to reload, as well as some quick basic safety tips, since he didn't want his slave-soldiers to accidentally shoot themselves or each other. He had them practice on a wedge of moldy cheese from his refrigerator, and then sent them off on the rat hunt.

Nikita, being the bravest, took point. She led the other two toward a rat hole in the wall.
"We go in!" Nikita bravely exclaimed.
"N... Nikita... I'm scared. And this gun is heavy and I'm cold and tired. Can we take a break?" Anna said, her nude body quivering.
Nikita smacked Anna on the back of the head.
"Not until we're inside the rat lair where Master can't see us. We can't let our master see us sitting around. If we look useless he might kill us for being bad slaves!" Nikita said.
"But what if we are attacked by rats?" Anna said.
The naked girl was freaking out now. Just the thought of being eaten by a rat was enough to shake her. Anna wasn't really a fighter at her heart.
"What if we shoot into the hole before we go in? You know, like a warning shot?" Lynette suggested.
"Great idea!" Nikita said.
Anna lifted her weapon and fired into the darkness of the rat hole, screaming hysterically.
"EEEEEEEEEEE!" She shrieked, nearly ready to cry.
To their surprise, they heard a pained grunt inside, followed by a loud thump. The three slave-soldiers looked on in bewilderment.
"I will go in and look." Nikita said.
She soon emerged, dragging a large fat dead rat by the tail behind her, dripping blood from almost a dozen bullet holes.
"I... I killed a rat?" Anna said, surprised.
"You sure did! First confirmed kill! Good job, Anna!" Nikita said.
"Wow, Anna, I didn't think you had it in you." Lynette said.
Anna smiled and blushed. She wasn't used to being complimented like this.
"Th... Thanks, you guys." She said.

What do the girls do next?
11332212.title: Rat Hunt

choices: They find a nest of baby rats
113322121.content:
The three tiny girls walked deeper into the rat hole. They heard scurrying and squeaking around them, but it was very dark and scary. Even Nikita, the bravest girl, was a little frightened.
"This is very dark. I can barely see and this is scary. Maybe we should go back..." Nikita said.
"Eek! Nikita, behind you!" Lynette said.
Nikita turned around and saw a large angry rat looking at her. Quickly, she blasted it in the chest and shot it dead. The defeated rat fell down with a dull *thud*
"Ooh! That was scary. I want to go back." Anna said.
Nikita was panting. It was a close call indeed.
"Wait! You two, I hear squeaking! Maybe we should investigate what is happening." Lynette said.
True, not far from where they were more squeaking could be heard.
"True, we might need to bring Master Zakhar more dead rats. Just think, he's been nice to us so far, but if we don't do a good enough job he might kill us or worse!" Nikita said.
Anna quivered at the thought. She ad heard of all the nasty, evil things abusive masters did to Tiny slaves.
"Right, we should investigate." Nikita said, uneasily.

What do the girls find?
113322121.title: Push deeper into the rat hole

choices: Agree with Nikita, Kill the baby rats
Agree with Anna, Bring them back to Master Zak
1133221212.content:
The girls stepped deeper into the darkness and found... some baby rats.
"Oh, they are only babies! you don't think...?" Lynette said.
"That those two rats we just killed were their mommy and daddy? Ya, we killed them. These rat babies are orphans now." Nikita said.
Anna felt sad, knowing she had killed the ratlings' mommy or daddy.
"Oh, these poor babies!" Anna said.
Lynette sighed.
"So, what should we do?" She said, shrugging her shoulders.
"We kill them. We were sent to kill rats, right? Well these are rats, just smaller and cuter. We kill and bring back to Master like good little hunters." Nikita said.
Anna quivered.
"No! I don't think I can do it! I can't hurt babies like this! Can't we bring them back to Mater and let him decide if they should die or not?" Anna said.

Lynette would have the deciding vote on what the girls do with the baby rats. On the one hand, Master Zak had sent them to exterminate the rats, but on the other hand the squeaking little baby rats were very cute.

What does Lynette do?
1133221212.title: They find a nest of baby rats

choices: Zak is pleased with their work
Zak is angry they killed the baby rats
11332212121.content:
"I say..." Lynette started slowly, "We kill them."

Anna looked horrified.

         "I-I can't--They're just babies! They're so cute, and... and..."

         "Quit thinking with your uterus and use that thing between your ears for once!" Nikita chastised rather harshly. "They might look cute now, but give them a couple weeks and they'll turn disgusting like those two monsters back there. Then they'll start breeding fucked up babies with each other and make the infestation even worse than before!" Nikita slung her gun on her back and shook Anna by the shoulders. "They're vermin, girl! Vermin!"

         "I-I..." Anna stammered, lower lip quivering, "I can't bear to kill them."

         "Fine." Nikita grunted. "Go stand over there and cover your ears. Lynette, come help me out."

Anna shuffled over to a corner and whimpered. Lynette joined Nikita.

         "So I figure we just... Do a... Like a sweep. Both of us. At least then if all of them aren't killed, they'll be too weak to fight back before we finish them. If we just went point blank one by one, the rest would freak and make a run for it, right?" Nikita said, pulling her rifle off her back and taking aim. "Ready?"

         "Ready." Lynette sighed, taking aim opposite to Nikita. Bullets flew, making quick work of the immature rats. Flesh shredded and casings clattered. Anna sobbed at the sound of gunfire and silenced squeals. Nikita and Lynette were drenched with gore as they stepped away from the mangled rat corpses.

         "We're done." Nikita smeared blood on Anna's shoulder as she turned Anna around. "Come on, you pansy. We gotta go report this."

         "But what about the bodies? Lynette asked.

         "We'll tell Master the job's done, then come and drag them out."

The trio slowly made their way out of the hole.

         "You look successful." Zak grinned at the girls, their little bodies dribbling puddles of blood on the floor.

         "We finished the job." Lynette stepped forward. "Master." She added after a slight pause. Poor Anna still stood wide-eyed and shell shocked.

         "How about you?" Zak asked Nikita. Drenched in what was left of their kill, she was hunched over and heaving, not from fear, but excitement. She looked hungry. Crazed. Bloodthirsty. Nikita's full lips were parted in an exuberant mad grin.

         "We slaughtered them all." She breathed. All of them. "They had a nest. We gunned it down. Sure, they were cute, but we knew they'd grow up to be just like their parents. Ugly, disgusting, disease-ridden.. Those vermin won't be bothering you anymore... Master."

Zak smiled. Nikita seemed to get a thrill from killing. Were she a normal-sized woman, it would have been unnerving, but at her size it was more endearing than anything. He wondered what she, and the others for that matter, would do if given the chance to kill again...
11332212121.title: Agree with Nikita, Kill the baby rats

choices: Have them do dangerous slave work
1133222.content:
Now that he had three tiny naked women to do with what he pleased, Zak decided to have some fun making their lives difficult. Once all three were in the water, he took his fingers and grabbed Lynette by her shoulders.
"Hey! What are you doing?" She shouted.

The entrance chamber of the arena split off into three different corridors and subsequently three rooms that further split into more specialized rooms. Scott had never been into this detestable place and was more than a little lost. He spotted a hooded figure who upon closer inspection was an anthro raven of great age.

"Hello, can I get your help? I have never been here before and I need to find where the large slaves are kept and I don't know where to look." Scott asked with a kind tone. "Large slaves?" answered the bird. "I can help. My name is Drex, you are?"
"My name is Scott."
"So Scott, why are you looking for a slave? And why do you need a large one?"
"I work on a farm and need an extra set of hands. It's cheaper this way than hiring an employee." That wasn't entirely the truth, but it was enough to prevent extra questions about his life.

Where there weren't booths there were auctioneer platforms where you could see demihumans being sold off left and right. It was deplorable. "Welcome to the Demihuman arena. Please, my booth is over this way," said Drex, smelling an opportunity.

Drex lead Scott into a tent filled with cages, wasting no time to bring you to the larger species in the center of the tent. "We have many species for sale. We have minotaurs, dragon newts, mammoths, and many more. Since you said you work on a farm, I have three slaves in mind. Here they are."

In the first cage was a minotaur, a female with the lower half of a cow and the upper half of a human. She sat on her bottom in the center of the cage, mindlessly combing her brown and blonde hair with her fingers. She tried to hide it, but she looked at you with disgust as you walked up to the cage with Drex. "This is our lovely minotaur, Ceria, one of our most recently obtained slaves. She is 6'8 and 500lbs. We found her out exploring one night, running away from her village. She was covered in cuts when we came across her. She ran to us panicked, said her name, and explained that she needed help as her village had been invaded by orcs. We subdued her fast and took her in, healed her wounds, and here she is. We tried to get more information out of her, but she doesn't trust us, no surprise there. Expect some resistance with her, but we have a remedy for that, heh."

The second cage had a centaur. A very young stallion curled up in the center of the cage taking a nap. "Here is a young lad, his name if Percious, like the Greek hero. He is about 5'4 and 350lbs, 16 years old. He isn't very strong, but he's proven to be smart as a whip. He was abused as a child and they eventually sold him to me about a year ago. We have been taking care of him since. Most people don't want to take care of children so it's been tough. The final cage contained an Anatolian Shepherd dog girl. She was incredibly alert and staring you and Drex down mystically. "This is Azra. She's 6'2 and 200lbs. We found her abandoned in an ally way as a puppy. We took her in and raised her ourselves 18 years ago. We taught her all she would ever need to know on how to be a slave. She loves the idea of being one. I think she enjoys the concept of being a slave a little too much. She's very fast, energetic, and loyal to a fault. She can be a little simple at times as well."

Each slave is given a slave crest on the chest to mark them as your property. "They used to be branded like cattle, but a ritual was discovered that combined the owner's blood into a special liquid that is then pained on the slave. The blood bond is what is then used to track. Recently the ritual was enchanted to force the slave to obey orders. All you need to say is 'That's an order!' and they will a horrible shock if they don't obey. Ok, we're ready to begin. There was no one walking through the street lamp illuminated snow drifts, there were no cars driving down the road slicked with ice, there weren't even any footprints leading to the door. Kailey just nervously shrugged it off. "It's just the wind. Yeah. It's...just the wind." she turned to go back inside and return to her studies when she spied a small package at her feet. She tenderly picked it up and brought it inside to inspect it. Kailey placed the box next to her chemistry textbook and looked it over. It was a plain brown package with clear packing tape to seal the top, but there was no delivery or return address. Something else peculiar about this box was that there were tiny holes throughout the sides, the size of pinpricks. "Oh, no..." Kailey thought. "What if there's an animal in there? I have to see..."
