He could do this. He launched himself over the table's edge before he could change his mind. After a split second of falling, Jason miraculously landed on his feet. His right foot slammed onto the wooden floor, the shock of the fall vibrating through his body. His left foot, however, was caught awkwardly. Jason grimaced and cried out as his ankle twisted and snapped with a sickening crack. Tears ran down his cheeks as he limped forward, not daring to be caught by the giant girl. If that happened, he'd be as good as dead. If he could find a place to hide, he may stand a fighting chance.
12111111.title: Jason attemts escape

choices: Kailey returns, snapping him out of his memory
Jason gets taken to an assignment camp
121111111.content:
Jason grit his teeth and struggled against the pain as he continued forward. He supposed he could hide. As he crawled beneath the structure he huddled in fear of the giantess' return. If she found him like this, she'd kill him. But where would he go? He had no idea where he was to begin with. He sighed shakily and closed his eyes. All of this could have been avoided, yet he had been so stupid as to tempt fate. "This is your last chance." His parents had said. He thought they were joking. He wished they were joking. Jason started to cry.
"I'm sorry..." He wept as memories flooded his consciousness. "Sorry... Sorry... Sorry..."
"You really think the stories are true?" A woman's voice echoed in his head. His girlfriend, Kelsey.
"Nah. It's just some bullshit parents made up to scare their kids into obedience." Jason laughed, downing a shot of whiskey.
"Hey... Maybe you should slow down a little..." Kelsey suggested, noticing the once full bottle was now half empty.
"Shut up, bitch..." Jason slurred as he grabbed her shoulders roughly. "I'll stop when I wanna stop."
"Jason, let go of me." Kelsey demanded. "You're drunk." To her relief, he released her. Unfortunately, he poured another drink. "You've had enough." She said, taking the bottle. "Come on, I'll drive you home."
"I'm fine..." He replied with an odd lapse in his speech. He got up and stumbled towards his car.
"Jason, please..." Kelsey begged. "Give me your keys." Jason ignored her, getting the key into the ignition on the third try. He was dangerous when he was drunk. Kelsey honestly was surprised she managed to take the bottle from him without getting a black eye. The car door shut and the engine turned over. "PLEASE, Jason." Kelsey pleaded urgently. "Don't..." He backed out of the driveway. She wanted to call the police. But... She loved him... By the time she entered the house to call, Jason was already halfway home.
"Fuckin' cunt thinks she can tell me what to do..." He ranted as he swerved down an empty highway. "Goddamn bitch doesn't know how good she's got it... Stupid fucking whore..." One strong swerve later, his thoughts were interrupted by a terrible metallic screech. "Oh shi-..." Jason, having neglected to wear his seatbelt, smashed headfirst though the windshield. He slammed into the pavement, losing consciousness instantly.
"Jason..." Someone's voice, a familiar one, cut through the darkness. "Jason, please wake up..." He wearily opened his eyes.
"Wh-what happened...?" The steady tone of a heart monitor assaulted his ears. Everything hurt.
"You were in a car accident. Ended up wrapped around a telephone pole."
"D-Dad?" Jason stammered as he looked at the displeased expression of his father. A woman stood next to him, tears streaming down her cheeks. "Mom?"
"Jason... Oh, Jason... How could you?..." She buried her face in her husband's shoulder.
"I-I... I'm sorry..." He apologized, his lips trembling as the gravity of the situation hit him.
"No you're not." His father replied. Jason stared at him, refusing to believe his father would say such a thing.
"But Dad, I-"
"You could have killed somebody!" His father roared. Jason's dad put a hand against his forehead. "You flunked out of History and English two years in a row, petty larceny, vandalism, now drunk driving and trashing our car?! When's it going to end?! Where are you going to stop?!" His father shouted in exasperation.
"Dad please, just give me another chance and I'll-" Jason pleaded pathetically.
"NO! No more chances! This is what, the fourth time I've heard that BULLSHIT request from you?!" His father asked, enraged. "I've given you chances! I've given you more chances than anyone should deserve! Maybe I was wrong..." He turned away. "You know they want to press charges. Your mother and I managed to convince them otherwise..."
"Thank you..." Jason whispered gratefully. He wasn't going to jail...
"You can come in now." Jason's father said to two men outside the door. As they entered, Jason's blood turned to ice. They were dressed similar to riot cops and looked just as hardened. "After you're discharged from the hospital, these two men will take you to an assignment camp."
"No..." Jason wanted to cry. It couldn't be happening. "Please, no..." He looked desperately between his two parents. "Mom, Dad, don't do this!" He begged. His father glanced tiredly at him before walking out of the room without looking back. "Mom..." He stared at her as tears cascaded down his cheeks, "Please...?" Jason whimpered.
"I'm sorry..." She put her head down and followed her husband, condemning her son to his fate.
121111111.title: Jason manages to find a place to hide

choices: Jason stays in the hiding spot
1211111111.content:
"N-No Mom... I don't... I don't wanna go!" Jason wailed. His body jerked upwards when thunderous footsteps echoed in his ears. Oh no. No, no, no, no, no, no. Jason pushed himself further under the table, further into the shadows and dust.
         "I'm back~" Kailey smiled, her hands clasped around pieces of soft cloth and a water bottle. "Wait... wait a minute..." she nearly threw down what was in her hands. Jason watched fearfully as the massive being dropped to her knees and methodically searched the floor. "Where are you?!" Kailey called frantically. "Come out, this isn't funny! I won't be upset, I swear!"
         Jason coughed on the dust while fearfully clenching and unclenching his fist. His heart was beating so fast he couldn't count the beats per minute. He could leave his hiding spot to ease the giantess's mind, but... what if she was lying just to lure him out of safety?
1211111111.title: Kailey returns, snapping him out of his memory

12111111111.content:
Jason trudged out from underneath his hiding spot, perhaps against his better judgement. His cheeks burned and he didn't dare detract his gaze from the floor.

         "Oh," the giantess sighed in relief, "there you are!" She scooped up Jason in her hands and Jason flinched as her fingers brushed against his broken ankle. "Did you hurt yourself?! How did you get under the night table?" Kailey asked, concern creeping into her voice.

         "I-I... I slipped and fell..." Jason stammered. Kailey's eyes narrowed, making Jason break into a cold sweat.

         "You're lying." She responded. A chill went up Jason's spine and he swallowed the lump in his throat. "What really happened?"

         "I... I ran..." Jason admitted. "I jumped off the table, broke my ankle, and ran and hid." No sense in making the monster any more angry than she already was.
12111111111.title: Jason leaves the hiding spot

121111111112.content:
"Why would you run and hide from me?"
         "I-It's just that... um... you're really scary... and..." Jason murmured sheepishly.
         "I'm scary ?" Kailey repeated.
         "Uh huh..." Jason mumbled.
         "I'm... scary ." A wide, tooth filled grin spread across Kailey's mouth, but there was no happiness in that smile. "Well little man, if you think I'm scary now... You haven't seen anything yet."
121111111112.title: Kailey is angry

choices: Jason goes to his intial evaluation
Jason tries to figure out what's going on
1211111112.content:
The assignment camp. Some called it "The Appraisal Camp". Those who had attended it opted for the more fitting "Gate of Hell" or "The Slave House". The outside was ordinary red brick. The property held a carefully cared for courtyard, encased with trimmed hedges around the perimeter. However, inside these hedges were electrified fences, should anyone get the bright idea to escape. Jason learned that the hard way.
"Get moving." Barked one of the men flanking him. Jason hesitantly stepped through the doorway. He may have well been walking towards the electric chair. The room he entered must have been a rec room. Teens were sitting at tables playing cards or chatting, by the way they acted, it would appear they were at a summer camp that they voluntarily attended.
"I don't wanna be here..." Jason mumbled, as if he had any choice.
"You should have thought of that before." The guard responded. "Up this way." He said, gesturing to a staircase. Jason followed him. Upstairs appeared to be some sort of dormitory, the long hallway painted a pastel blue for boys. "Come on." The man placed a gloved hand on the doorknob of a door inscribed with the number 25. It creaked open, revealing the ordinary room.
"Oh! Hi there. You must be Jason, is that right?" A man stood in the middle of the room with an unending smile on his face.
"Uh-huh..." Jason nodded, taken aback severely. This reaction didn't dampen the man's enthusiasm in the slightest.
"Well, this is where you'll be staying. I was just checking to make sure it was all set up for you. My name's Chad, by the way, and I'll be your handler during your experience here. Your schedule is posted on the back of the door there, if you don't report to your scheduled activity someone will be up to check on you. Dinner's at five, and in about an hour after you've had time to adjust, you'll be taken to your initial evaluation. Any questions?" Chad's smile never faltered once.
"How long am I gonna be here?" Jason asked warily.
"Well that all depends on you. Kids with certain attributes can get out within a week, while those with a more defiant nature typically stay for about a month undergoing conversion therapy (A/N: no not that kind of conversion therapy, you sickos). However, those kids can get out a lot faster, depending on what's in demand." Chad grinned, "Does that answer your question?"
"S-Sure..." Jason stammered. Conversion therapy? Kids being in demand? What the hell was this place, some sort of underage whorehouse?
"So, I guess if that's all cleared up I'll let you get settled." Chad turned towards the door, being followed by the two guards. "I hope you have a nice time here." He said, closing the door and leaving Jason alone. Jason sighed, laying down on the bed.
"I really don't wanna be here..." He murmured, unable to shake the dread in his stomach. He spread his arms and legs, hitting something awkward on the corner of the bed. "Huh?..." Jason sat up and inspected it.
Leather straps.
1211111112.title: Jason gets taken to an assignment camp

12111111121.content:
Jason idly laid on the bed, mulling his life choices. He had been severely upset over his parents' decision but he could see where they were coming from. The more he thought about it, the sicker he felt. There was a secret to this place. Something that only lived through kids and teens as rumors, that was revealed as truth during adulthood if you managed to not get sent to one of these awful places. Jason laughed a dry, spiteful laugh. It was only when faced with the consequences that he ever gave his actions a second thought. A knock at the door startled him slightly.
"Yes?" Jason asked as he opened the door. A thin woman in her thirties smiled at him from the other side.
"Ah. You must be Jason, correct?" she replied as Jason opened the door further.
"Who wants to know?"
"My name is Erin. I'll be escorting you to your initial evaluation." She responded. Jason begrudgingly followed her down the hallway, heading towards a separate wing of the building. After a few minutes of walking, Jason attempted to make small talk.
"So..." He started, "What exactly do you do with kids once they've completed their tests or reached your standard or whatever?" Under his breath, he murmured, "because they sure as hell don't go home."
"You'll see..." Erin replied, the slightest bit of irritation creeping into her voice. Jason tried again,
"I uh... I notice there were leather straps on my bed. Why is that?"
"Protocol." Erin shrugged, swiping a key card and opening a door. "In here, please."
"Yes, but why?" Jason strained.
" Look, some of our arrivals have very violent tendencies. Make of that what you will." Erin snapped, not in the mood for anymore questions.
"Alright, alright..." Jason responded tensely as he stepped into the room. Note to self: Don't piss anyone off while you're here.
"Hi, you must be Jason." Another woman approached him, dressed in a lab coat. Probably a doctor. She shook his hand. "Today we're going to do your initial evaluation as to make your transition as painless as possible. If you'd take a seat on that bench over there." She gestured to the far wall. Jason gazed around as he wandered towards the bench. This whole place looked like a doctor's office. Jason hated the doctor's office.
"Transition?" Jason asked as he took a seat. "What transition?" The woman stared at him with icy eyes before turning away, acting like she hadn't heard him.
"So, I need you to answer a few questions for me, Jason." She requested coolly, taking a seat behind a computer monitor.
"Sure."
"Blonde hair... Blue eyes..." She murmured as she typed something into her computer. "Alright then! General demeanor?" She finally asked him.
"Excuse me?"
"You know, cheerful, moody, quick to anger?" She clarified, not looking up from her computer.
"Uh... Mild? I don't really know... A little jaded?" He answered tentatively.
"Really?" She asked with genuine interest, "Because your file says something quite different." Jason's insides twisted.
"What do they say...?"
"Reckless. Violent when drunk." She responded flatly, a tiny sadistic smirk curling on the edges of her lips.
"THAT WAS ONE TIME!" Jason objected pathetically. The woman raised an eyebrow.
"Well, it wasn't just one time. It was never just one time. If it was, you wouldn't be here." She leaned in, "Would you?"
"No..." He answered tearfully. "Probably not." The woman stood up from her computer.
"Well... That's it for the oral part of the examination. I'm going to need you to remove your clothing for this next part."
"Uh..." Jason was at a loss for words but hesitantly took his shirt off.
"I need assistance in Examination Room B." The woman went over intercom. Soon enough, a man and a woman entered, also dressed in lab coats.
"What's going on?" Jason asked as the hair on the back of his neck stood up.
"Don't worry about it." The man responded, stepping over to a stainless steel examination table that Jason had somehow missed before.
"It'll be easiest if you just cooperate..." The woman responded, holding his left arm and making a tourniquet. She held a syringe filled with a mystery drug, preparing to shove its needle into his muscle. "Now, just relax..." She cooed.
"Get that thing away from me!" Jason screamed, jerking his arm out of her grasp. He looked around wildly. Three very angry doctors and... The door. The door out of here.
12111111121.title: Jason goes to his intial evaluation

121111111211.content:
Don't think. Just run. Jason bolted towards the door, and to his luck, it opened. He guessed no kid had gotten this far before. Otherwise it would have been locked.
"Shit... " Jason looked both ways. Identical corridors. He sprinted down the left hallway, the one he thought he remembered coming from. His uneven footsteps pounded on the tile as he made his escape. Were he not so panicked, he may have found it odd that none of the doctors gave chase.
"Perhaps his therapy regimen should be more rigorous?" The male doctor suggested, completely ignoring the patient tearing down the hallway.
"I agree." The primary doctor replied, entering the note into Jason's file. "I believe it would be beneficial to him if we bumped up his projected exit time by a week or two. Considering recent events, this should be brought to the administration's attention immediately."
"I'll do so right away." The male doctor replied, picking up a hard copy of Jason's file and hurrying out the door.
Jason, meanwhile, had no clue where he was. This wing was a far cry from the brightly colored dormitories and rec rooms meant to keep the captive kids content. This wing was clinical, white walls, tiled floors, and keypad locked doors. Jason shivered. It was medical, but there was no aura of healing to be found. Jason felt that if he managed to open one of these doors he would see some kid strapped down and experimented on like a lab rat. What was going on? He continued until the end of the hall. Nothing looked familiar. To his left there was a heavy steel door with an observation window. To his right there was a door with a staircase leading further down into the complex. In his current predicament, either one seemed preferable to being caught.
121111111211.title: RUN!

choices: Jason gets escorted back to his room
1211111112111.content:
Jason frantically scrambled towards the heavy steel door. No way in hell was he going anywhere near that creepy basement. This place had a secret, he knew that much. Though... one thing rubbed him the wrong way, putting a lump in his throat and making his hands shake. Why was no one chasing him? It would make sense if they had just lost track of him in the complex with all the identical hallways, but as far as Jason knew, no one had gone after him the second he bolted from the examination room. He shuddered as he placed his hands against the cool metal door, not daring to look through the examination window. He leaned up against it just a bit and to his surprise... it opened. His mouth went dry and his breathing quickened. Shouldn't it be locked by keycard or entry code like every other fucking door in this wretched place? Maybe even just a simple fucking padlock, but no, there was no lock to be found. A muffled grunt came from beyond the door. Jason shivered. He fully pushed the door open and stepped inside. What he saw would forever haunt his mind.
A stainless steel table sat in the center of the otherwise bare room, looking uncomfortably similar to a sacrificial altar. IV bags surrounded the table, pumping God knows what into the poor soul writhing on the table. He was held down with those all too familiar leather straps. What were they doing to him? Jason cautiously approached him.

"H-hey... My name's Jason, I'm gonna-!" Jason jumped back, sickened by what lay before him. That thing was monstrous. Its head was shaved, giving view to ugly criss-crossing scars on its scalp along with fresh incisions sewn up with thick black thread. Jason gagged. Did they give this kid a lobotomy? "Wh-what in the hell did they do to you?..." he whispered. Its green eyes nearly bored a hole into Jason's skull with its unrelenting stare. It silently moved its lips, trying to speak.

"That is none of your concern." An icy chill ran up Jason's back as firm hands were placed on his shoulders. He was spun around to face a very angry doctor. "What are you doing here?"

"I-I... I was..." Jason stammered.

"You're not supposed to be here." the doctor asserted, pushing Jason through the door and into the hallway, leaving the experiment behind. "For now, I'll chalk it up to a simple mistake. But I warn you that for your own sake, you'll forget what you saw here today." Jason was stunned. The doctor continued, "I'm going to take you back to your room, and you'll continue your schedule as normal, understood?" Jason nodded nervously.
1211111112111.title: Left- Through the door

12111111121111.content:
"Y-Yes, sir..." Jason mumbled, starting down the hall. His body shook. His cheeks burned with embarressment and his heart throbbed in his chest. What was going on in there? What in the world did that... that... amalgamation do to deserve such a fate? Jason dragged his feet down the hallway as he glanced sheepishly at the stern doctor.

         "I don't know how you managed to get into this wing. I won't bother to ask, as severe consequences await you if you tell any of the other... residents... about what you've seen here today. Is that understood?" The doctor asked. Jason clenched his teeth and nodded. Jason could have alluded to the fact that the "experiment" was apparently one of the punishments, but he smartly kept his mouth shut.

         "So... How long will I be here for?" Jason asked warily. The doctor snorted.

         "Ask your handler. Not even one day here and you've already been bumped up a week or two for projected exit time." The doctor paused, stared deep into Jason's eyes, and continued morbidly, "That's not a good thing."

Jason couldn't help but imagine being tied up and assaulted relentlessly by multiple men and women.

         "But where will I go?" Jason pressed. All this talk about exit times, but not a single clue as to where he'd be going after he was released.

         "You'll see. Don't worry about it. For now, I would just recommend shaping up your behavior. The better you are temperamentally, the better you'll be in the long run." The doctor responded cryptically. "By this weekend I imagine your handler will approach you about your projected exit time."

         "Great." Jason replied. He was genuinely happy about this development. The sooner he knew when he would be out of here, the sooner he could run for his life.

         "We're here." The doctor unceremoniously threw open the dormitory door and ushered Jason inside.

         "So..." Jason started, "Where am I allowed to go?"

         "During your time at this camp, with the free time on your schedule, you're allowed to either stay in your room or socialize in the rec room. Your next activity, which occurs in half an hour, requires you to be in the gymnasium. You will be tested on strength and dexterity. It will last approximately an hour, then you'll attend dinner. After dinner, you will attend a session on beauty, spa treatments, and general wellness, which takes place in Room 204. When that is said and done, you'll have two hours before lights out. I'll speak with your handler as to when you can... make up... your evaluation, with some minor adjustments to your file. Also, if you'd like, you may skip the gym class for today. Given recent developments, your scheduled activities will be increased nearly twofold." dispassionately replied the doctor.

         Jason's mind swam with the information fed to him. What the hell was even going on? The more he knew about what was expected of him, the sicker he felt. At this point, Jason knew only one thing. He had to get out of here as soon as possible.

(A/N: I changed a few things to correct a continuity error. So, in the event you're giving this a re-read, you're not going crazy, it did change)
12111111121111.title: Jason gets escorted back to his room

choices: Listen to Matt and Connor's stories
121111111211112.content:
"Well... I might as well make some friends while I'm in this shithole..." Jason sighed, exiting his room. He trudged down to the rec room and scanned the kids over. His eyes settled on a group of three, two boys, one girl. He approached them cautiously.
         "Hey, what's up?" The girl, appearing to be Asian in descent, greeted him. "My name's Rose. You new around here?"
         "Uh... Yeah." Jason confirmed, his eyes lewdly gazing over her B-cup breasts. "I'm uh, I'm Jason." he replied, snapping his attention back to her face. "Today's my first day."
         "Oh. Well, that's Matt, short for Mattias, not Matthew," she nodded towards one of the boys, a scrawny, pale-faced blond, "and that's Connor." Rose pointed to a boy with scruffy black hair down past his ears. Both boys and Rose looked to be within two years of Jason, who was seventeen, only a month before he became eighteen. If only he had lasted that month... Unfortunately, the law was not in his favor, stating that in the event anyone crossed the line of their 18th birthday while in an assignment camp, they would still be proccessed as if they weren't a legal adult, leaving kids who "aged out" no reprieve. "How about you sit down and we can talk?" Rose suggested, patting the couch cushion next to her.
         "S-sure." Jason stammered, taking a seat next to the perky girl. "So, uh..." Jason attempted to start a conversation, "What brought you all here?" His eyes widened as Rose's hand quickly clamped over his mouth.
         "We're um... We're not allowed to talk about that. No one here is." Matt chuckled nervously. "We don't know what will happen if we get caught breaking that rule, but... we don't want to find out."
Images of the horrific, inhumane experiment flashed in Jason's mind.
         "So what are we allowed to talk about?"
         "Well, we can talk about... What life was like before we got sent here." Rose suggested.
         "Alright, then." responded Jason passively. "So who wants to go first?"
         "How about you go first, Matt?" Connor snickered, elbowing the much smaller boy in the ribs. "Matt here's a tithe "
         "Fuck off." Matt muttered. "Why don't you go first?" Sensing the hostility in the room rising, Jason stole a glance at the digital clock mounted on the wall, displaying the time in piercing red numbers: 4:45. Fifteen more minutes until dinner.
121111111211112.title: Make some friends

choices: The four of them go to dinner
1211111112111121.content:
"There's not much to tell, really." Connor scratched the back of his neck. "My impulse control is fucking terrible. I'm very much an "act now, think later" sort of person and it's gotten me into a lot of screwed up shit over the years. One day, I "woke up" and found myself behind the wheel of my parents' car, heading out to God knows where." He laughed regretfully. "I should have asked for help, or something like that, but I fucked myself over and my parents signed that order before I could get a word in edgewise." Connor paused. "I've got a younger brother, about fifteen. I wonder..." He swallowed, sounding like he was on the verge of tears, "I wonder how he feels when he wakes up and I'm not there anymore?"
         "How long have you been here, Connor?" Jason asked.
         "They don't normally give you a way to accurately judge days, but... going by day and night cycles, I'd say... about two weeks?" He smiled sarcastically and scoffed. "Even when you're halfway out of this fucking place they don't tell you where you're going. It could be anything from being locked in jail to being fed through a woodchipper, and I'm still none the wiser."
         "Wait a second... Isn't telling me about your life before you came here the same as telling me what got you here in the first place?"
         "Nah." Connor replied. "For most of us there was a "last straw" sort of thing. "Most of us are unlucky enough to screw up over, and over... So much so that our parents don't want to deal with us anymore. It's times like this that I wonder if they know where we're going..." Connor's shoulders drooped a bit. "Oh, but Matt's got one hell of a story. Don't you, Matt?" smirked Connor. "Get this... Matt's parents had him specifically to give him up to this place."
         "Shut your mouth." Matt fired back. "At least my parents wanted me. " Jason could see tiny twitches in Connor's facial muscles as his jaw clamped down. Matt had definitely hit a nerve.
         "Stop fighting!" Jason shouted, earning the stares of a few other teens in the room. "Matt, did your parents tell you anything about why you're here or why you were even born ?" Matt shook his head.
         "The only thing they told me was... I was going to serve a great purpose. They said I was destined to save others, to bring comfort to those in pain, and to sacrifice myself for the sake of the greater good."
         "How long have they been telling you this?" Jason asked.
         "Ever since I could understand them. About three years old or so? Maybe even earlier."
         "I'm not getting anywhere with this..." Jason muttered, closing his eyes.
         "Well..." Rose was clearly uncomfortable with what she was going to say next. "After dinner, we could all... Try and look deeper into this place."
         "But what if we get caught?" Jason asked.
         "What the hell are they gonna do, kick us out ?" responded Connor. "I'm in. It's either get out of here or get stuck in here for years. That's too much of a reward to give up."
         "Matt?"
         "This plan sucks." Matt stated bluntly. "But I'll help."
         "Alright then." smiled Rose coyly. "It's settled."
1211111112111121.title: Listen to Matt and Connor's stories

choices: Kailey lets him get some rest
121111112.content:
No matter how much Jason attempted to move he couldn't even move an inch (to a tiny) with all the pain soaring through his body, what the hell was he thinking jumping from a height like that it's a miricale he didn't break every bone in his body. He suddenly felt earthquakes, he knew he was dead if he got caught here attempting to escape. He felt some form of Déjà vu for some reason but he coulden't tell why, but this wasn't the time to think about his past. His heart began pounding somewhere around 200 pumps per second (rough estimate) as the giant figure of the girl stood in the massive door way. "I'm bac... Huh where are you?" She was confused, this was his big chance he just needed to give it his all just for this few seconds... "AAAAAHHHHHH!!" He screamed in agony as he tried to move at all. "Huh..." She looked right at him and her face turned not to anger but to a more scarred face if anything. She quickly sat down all the objects as she rushed over to Jason.

"You're gonna be ok just don't move your leg" Jason couldn't really believe it... was this girl about to try and save him... Kailey was as careful as she could be picking him up and placing him down on the table. She managed to make a makeshift cast form out of random things from her desk. Jason was shocked at this he had never heard of a gentle giant they were always meant to be these uncaring monsters, but she was... Kind, Nice, Gentle, and admittedly cute (for a giant). "Now why were you on the floor with a broken leg, you weren't trying to run, were you?" Jason feared admitting it the last thing he wanted to do was make her mad or anything else really. "No... I... I slipped and broke my leg on accident" Jason sputtered, judge from her unamused face she wasn't buying it. "For staters don't lie to me no matter what, and 2nd don't try to run away at you tiny I could easily crush you on accident or something else could get you, do you understand" Jason just nods his head...
121111112.title: Nothing but pain

choices: Kailey tries to calm him down
Kailey is tired of his resistance
1211111121.content:
"Please... Let me go. I won't tell another living soul that you exist, I swear!" Jason trembled with fear as the giantess wrapped his leg in scraps of cloth. He stood up slowly, testing the splint.
         "I can't." she replied flatly. "Not after that. Do you even know where you are?"
         "I... no..." Jason responded sheepishly.
         "Then where would you go after you left?" came Kailey's sage reply. Jason was at a loss of what to say as they sat in silence.

Anna picked up the nail scissors, opening and closing them a few times. "Snip, snip, snip..." She said rather childishly. "You wanna go home, right?" Dan reluctantly nodded. She stared at the scissors blankly. "Hey, how d'you think your family would feel about getting you back in pieces?"

         "I-I..." The squeak barely left Dan's throat. He hoped, prayed, needed her to just be joking, but at this point he couldn't count on anything anymore.

         "I'm not ready to give you up just yet." Dan quietly sighed in relief when she put the scissors down. "Hm..." She mulled her options, occasionally glancing around the room for additional tools. "I think... I'll use... This!" She grabbed the sewing pin and lighter. The lighter was lit after a few tries, and the tip of the needle glowed red-hot. Tossing the lighter over her shoulder, Anna placed the burning needle just above Dan's chest. Dan's eyes watered. He wasn't sure if it was from fear or the heat. The needle plunged down. The noise of Dan's scream was barely discernible as human, reverberating through his skull. He couldn't tear his eyes away from the unfolding scene. A searing stake of metal was about to force its way through his skin and entangle itself in his guts, severely wounding if not killing him. Dan's stomach plummeted. The needle came down... and missed.

         Dan's shirt singed and skin stung from the burn of flesh on metal, but that was it. His organs stayed where they belonged. She had faked him out. She was still grinning madly at him. She tore up the pins with one hand, her other fiercely swiping Dan off the table. Dan was certain in that moment, he would die. What he hadn't been counting on was falling into a heap of clothes on the floor. He dragged himself out, dizzy and disoriented, and came face-to-face with a new reality.

         He had only ever seen her close to her level, at her hips or higher. But now, as he stumbled backwards on the floor and she rose to her full height before him, Dan was forced to take in her full stature the way it was meant to be viewed. The top of his head just barely managed to reach her ankle bone. It was truly a sight to behold. She became less like a person with every advancing step, and more and more like an organic weapon. Something meant to cut down, destroy, crush, and tear anything in her way, that wouldn't stop until her target was neutralized or dead. Dwarfed in her shadow, Dan trembled.

         "You truly are a pitiful creature... Do you really think you could run from me? Do you really believe you deserve a life outside of this?" She raised an eyebrow as she sneered down in contempt, anticipating Dan's next move. Dan stared up, wracking his brain for an answer and silently moving his lips, but no words would come out.

         Dan found himself rendered unable to speak, reduced to a stammering mess. What could he say?

         "No, of course not." She berated. "Of course not, you pathetic, ugly thing..." She took a step forward, covering more ground in one stride than Dan could hope to at a sprinting pace. Dan cowered in between her feet. "I could crush you right now, like a little bug... I bet I wouldn't even feel you."

         "N-no... Please, please... D-don't..."

         "Then give me a reason."

         "A..."

         "A reason, Daniel. Now."

         "I don't wanna die..." Dan whimpered softly.

         "Not good enough."

         "Be..." He gently gripped his side. "Because you need me. Because somewhere in that freak show mind of yours, you love me too much to let me die. Isn't that right?"

         "Maybe you're not as stupid as I first thought..." Anna had a contented look on her face while she bent over and raised Dan nearly 150 feet in the span of a few seconds. "If you'd use half of that intelligence towards compliance instead of defiance, your life might be a little better." She tossed him and his new clothes into his temporary home. "Try a little obedience next time. Might work in your favor. I'll come back with some burn cream to help you through that, at least."

         "Thanks..." Dan begrudgingly mumbled as he changed out of his singed and piss stained clothes. Anna abruptly closed the drawer on him, much to Dan's discontent. She'd get another pet. She decided. A little leverage never hurt, playing a game like this...

choices: Anna comes back to visit her new "pets"
They all try to get to know each other better
123111122211121112121121221211.content:
”No! Let us go! Let us go, you--!”

         Transfixed in horror, Dan scooted far, far away from the sight. Standing above him was his captor with a squirming person in each hand. A young blonde woman was draped over her right fist, sobbing. In her left, a dark-haired man screaming in impotent frustration and terror.

         ”Dan?” The giantess happily ignored the protests of the people in her hands, “I brought you some friends!”

         ”F-Friends?” Dan stammered. Anna’s “new” pet man looked at Dan in a silent state of horror. This poor man had been kidnapped and broken. The same would happen to himself and the woman. Then… They would all suffer together...

         ”Mhmm!” She dropped her two captives carelessly. “Now, you all be nice to each other...” Anna warned. Dan’s eyes stayed locked in a traumatized thousand-yard stare as she thundered off into the distance to let them get properly acquainted. The blonde buried her face into the man’s shoulder and sobbed. The man looked to be having a hard time dealing with the situation himself, waiting for Dan to brief them on the nightmare they were about to endure.

         ”What she said… I… Please, you have to understand, I didn’t want this… I didn’t… I didn’t want this...” Dan shook his head slightly, “I didn’t… I didn’t...”

         ”Hey… Hey… I’m sure you didn’t.” the new arrival tried to gently comfort the man in front of him. Clearly he wasn’t here of his own volition, either. “Take a deep breath. We need you to help us.” He squeezed the shoulder of the inconsolable woman. His calmness was of course, a front. Inside, he was screaming and terrified as much as the others, but he’d never get any answers if he broke down now. Dan took in a shaking breath.

         ”Okay...” He sniffled, wiping tears from his face. “Um… Wh-What are your names? I’m Dan.” The man nodded.

         ”My name is Jack.” A disdainful smirk crossed his lips. “Just like “Jack and the Beanstalk”. Never thought I’d be fuckin’ living it though...”

         ”I-I’m Amanda. O-Or Mandy, for short.” the woman shyly piped up.

         ”Okay...” Dan cleared his aching throat and sat up straight. Terror didn’t begin to define what he was feeling. He had been given the task of telling these two poor innocent people what they were going to endure until they either died or she got tired of them. “S-S-So, um… I need to know a little bit about you before I can… Um, what I mean is… Do you… Have you ever, uh… seen them before? Like, did you know they existed, or--”

         ”No.” Came Jack’s curt reply. He didn’t want to dwell on it. Mandy shook her head.

         ”No...”

         ”So you were kidnapped too?” Dan mumbled. “I-I think… I think it’s fair to warn you right now that I can only help you in… limited ways… Like… If you thought I could help you escape… That is not happening.” Dan shuddered. “I-It’s not like I don’t want to, but...” He started to cry. “There’s no way out of this place… Th-This drawer? She lets me—and now you too—live here out of “kindness”. I-If she didn’t, sh-she’d probably...” Slightly collecting his bearings, Dan pulled up his shirt and winced. “S-See this burn? Th… That’s… What she gave me when… I refused to fuck her. God only knows what she’d do if we tried to run...”

         ”This is just perfect.” Jack climbed to his feet. “Just FUCKING perfect!” His facade started to crack.

         ”Wait a minute...” Dan slowly observed. “You’re wearing clothes.”

         ”So are you.” Mandy interjected.

         ”Yeah, but… I wasn’t before. When I came here, I mean. I was naked.”

         ”How long have you been here, Dan? What’s she gonna do to us? What does she do to you?” Jack rapidly fired, completely ignoring Dan’s revelation.

         ”Um...” blood rose to Dan’s face. “Things...” He refused to elaborate. He couldn’t. “B-But uh… I’m not sure how long I’ve been here. A few days? A couple weeks? My sleep schedule’s kind of fucked up, and with it being winter and all, the sun doesn’t come out very often…” Jack dejectedly looked at the ground.

         ”She expects us to live in her underwear drawer?”

         ”It’s better than what I showed up in. A plastic box. I don’t… I don’t think she’s trying to degrade us with it, either. It was just… convenience. It’s warm and soft, at least.” Dan tapped the tights he was standing on with his hand. “Spacious...” Jack truly felt pity for the man before him. Dan was quite obviously trying to scrape together every silver lining he could find to keep his sanity. “Y-You’ll get used to it too, don’t worry.” Dan continued. “J-Just like I am. Then soon enough, it’ll barely… Barely even...” Dan quietly sank to the ground and started to cry. “Th-This wasn’t… This wasn’t supposed to happen, it wasn’t supposed to be this way...” Mandy wrapped her arms around the stranger.

         ”Shh. It’ll be okay. You're okay. We're all okay. We’ll get through this. We’ll all get through this, don't worry. We know you didn’t want this to happen… We know...” He wasn’t a stranger anymore. He was Dan. And Dan, Jack, and herself were now in this together for better or worse.
123111122211121112121121221211.title: You're Not Alone

choices: Jack and Mandy manage to slip out of her grasp
1231111222111211121211212212111.content:
”Hi again, cuties. You all get acquainted?” Anna peered over the edge of the drawer like some monster about to devour a village.

         ”Yeah...” Dan was the only one brave enough to speak at this point. “And I mean, I told you I didn’t want to share you, but...” He pouted and got a little mouthy in bratty mock-anger as he glanced back at the two other terrified prisoners. She thought it was “cute”...

         ”How could I not? I mean, look at them!” Mandy and Jack held each other protectively. “They’re adorable... How could I resist?” Anna raised an eyebrow. “Don’t pretend like you don’t appreciate it. Lying doesn’t suit you, Dan.” Dan glanced around nervously. Had she really seen through the facade? “I know you don’t want to be alone at night. Now you’re not!” Dan let out a quiet grumble.

         ”Yeah, alright, you caught me...”

         ”Hey! You remember that nice video I posted online that everybody loved?! Huh, huh, huh?!” The creepiest smile Dan had ever seen spread across her face. Dan turned ghost-pale and gulped.

         ”Y-Yeah, I remember… What about it?”

         ”Wellll… I thought it would only be appropriate if I made a second one in honor of my new pets!” She was beaming. Jack was locked in place, Mandy was staring tearfully, and Dan found himself mouthing the word “no” over and over like he couldn’t control himself. Anna quickly snatched Jack and Mandy out of the drawer before they even got a chance to scream. “Baby, I’m gonna make you a star!”

“I Got Two New Pets Today!”

She held up two shaking people in her palm.

         “Hey! So, um… Like the title says, I got two new pets today!” She glanced down at the cowering figures. “Ahaha!” She gently brushed her fingertip against the man’s hair as he tried futilely to fight her off. “Um… I found them… around, y’know, outside. And… They didn’t like it very much at first when I picked them up. But I think they’re getting used to it. It’ll take a while, but I’m excited! Their names are Jack and Mandy. Yeah, like “Jack and the Beanstalk”. How appropriate.” The man appeared to be hurriedly pushing the giantess’ other captive, a blonde woman, towards the edge of the hand in an escape attempt. She knocked them back without even looking down. “They’re uh… pretty naughty right now, but I um, think I’ll get through to them eventually. One way or the other.” She popped her lips, idly rolling her captives’ bodies with her thumb. “Ah—They can talk, too. The man’s only said mean stuff so far.” She childishly pouted. “That’s okay, though! Cause I know he doesn’t really mean it. ‘nd even if he does now, that’ll change.” She gently squeezed her fist closed. “So, um, yeah! I gotta get to training them, um... I’ll update in a couple days. I’m sure they’ll be perfectly behaved by then. Ahaha! Byeee!”

“Hey Guys! Guess What Happened Today?!”

An older video, one she pulled up just to watch again.

         Dan looked around frantically for a way out of this nightmare. Her hands were folded under her chin and she wore a placid smile. Dan gazed up at her, shaking down to his bones. His eyes darted to the camera.

         “Help me… Please, help me… I-I… I don’t know where I am, but I… I don’t wanna be here, sh-she… She kidnapped me. M-Maybe track her IP address or something, I don’t—Someone, please… mmph--!” An enormous hand gently pushed Dan back like an organic wall.

         “Hey, what’s up?! Like he was saying, I uh… “found” a new pet today! His name’s Dan and he’s the cutest, sweetest little thing I’ve ever seen, aha!” She giggled as the tiny man tried to combat her hand in an attempt to be seen again. “Oh! I guess he really wants to say hi! Calm down, little one, you’ll get your chance...” She twirled a strand of hair around her finger. “So um anyway… I’m having tons of fun with him! Discipline’s a little hard, but so far I just have to leave him alone for a long time. The hunger wins out in the end. Ooorrrr, sometimes I have to threaten to crush him to get him to do what I want. Mmm… That’s all I got to say for now. How about you, sweetie?” The camera zoomed in to clearly show Dan’s tear-tracked face.

         “Good God somebody help me! PLEASE!” Dan wept. “This is insane! It’s real! All of it, it’s all real! I-I-I… I don’t wanna die… She’ll kill me… I don’t wanna die...”

         “I think that’s enough, Daniel.” She placed a massive fingertip on Dan’s heaving chest. “Um, yeah, I’ll definitely be posting again! Remember to rate, comment, and subscribe if you wanna keep updated! And… I love you! See ya next time!” Dan turned to camera, sniffled, and let out a stifled whimper as it turned off.

         Anna’s mind floated as she blissfully remembered. None of them knew it was real, well, except the humans. All the tinies thought it was an act, a simple, green-screened fetish film. They had no idea that they themselves could be the next stars of the fantasy they loved so much. She loved making video diaries of her little pets. She could relive their first terrified moments over again as many times as she pleased. Anna glanced over to the closed drawer, where Mandy and Jack were recovering from being her most recent stars. She had a feeling these three would be very, very popular.

Mandy clung to Dan and cried. Jack stared at the ground despondently.

         “No, no, no, I was so close--! Th-those people, commenting… Th-they...” Jack swallowed back disgust. “They were like us. They were like us and they thought we were… actors. They thought she wasn’t real and we were actors for some fucking film to get their rocks off to. Well, they can take my fucking place, fine by me!”

         “Yeah… I know. She made one of me, too…” Dan sniffled and finished his drink, letting out a slight cough as it burned all the way down. “They sa—they said, “Maybe if he doesn’t like being a pet, he’d make a good snack” They wanted—They wanted her to fucking eat me. Said if I didn’t know how good I had it as her “pet” I’d be better off as food.” Dan’s cheeks flushed. “I tried to scream for help. They laughed. Some called me an ungrateful brat, said I should be tortured into submission for not enjoying being a giant’s pet.” He smiled crookedly. “Some of the funny ones, though. The guy who’s a giant and knows this is real, he said he wus jealous ‘f me. Sa—said he’d love to be one of us, said even if he wasn’t he’d come over here and be Anna’s slave with me ‘nd help me deal. Break the “illusion” that all giants are cruel. “Comfort me through it” or some shit like that.” Dan hiccuped and laughed, obviously blitzed. “’t was kinda cute, almost… like he actually cared ‘bout whut’s goin’ on here...” Dan began to yearn for another cup of the cheap rum Anna had let them have from her stash, but had no desire to get up from his reclining position. She’d given them enough to loosen up, but not enough to induce death from alcohol poisoning, should one decide to attempt it. “Then there wuz th’s one girl wh’ thought I wuz a actor fer some fetish company. Wanted m’ full name. Said I wuz a hottie ‘n could be a model. Tha’ wuz sweet… I mean, Anna says tha’ all th’ time, b’ considerin’ how psycho she is a...bout me, it doezn’t really mean ‘s mucsh, y’know?”

         “Yeah, they um...” Jack wrung his hands. “They wanted to know if she was still in “contact” with you. Wanted to see if you could… “reprise your role” as her pet slave.” Dan let out an amused drunken wheeze.

         “Shpose I dun’ really have a choice, do I?”

         “Dan… Maybe you should slow down a little.” Mandy piped up as Dan fell flat on his face in an attempt to get another glass of booze.

         “Nuh...” he mumbled. “I dun’ wanna scare you, Mandy, cuz you...” he hiccuped, “y’seem like a real sweetheart. Buh th’ reality is, she’s done shit t’ me I dun’ wanna remember ever again. Even this jus’ barely helps. Y’ll find out on yur own… Bad ‘s that sounds… B’ the difference is, me an’ Jack’ll be here fer ya, won’t we, Jack?!” Jack pitifully regarded the man in front of him, who had turned to alcohol as a coping mechanism. “Th’ difference b’tween us is...” Dan started bitterly. “When I went through this shtuff, I didn’t—didn’t have nobody. Jusht had t’ sit by m’self an’ cry it out.”

         “How awful...” Mandy whimpered.

         “’s okay.” Dan murmured. “’s much as I hate her fer trappin’ more people… can’t say I hate not bein’ alone anymore.”

123111122211121112121121221211111.content:
”So wh… whu’did you two do be—be… before yo...u were...uh...” Mandy paid little mind to the drunken man’s rambling as she gently guided Dan to sit on his bed.

         ”Here.” She pushed the bottle cap formerly filled with alcohol to Dan’s side. “Just in case you need to throw up.” Mandy was already on edge from the surreal situation and wasn’t about to see Dan literally torn to pieces because he had drank too much and puked on the floor.

         ”Bu—No, seriously—How-hh-how’d you get here?”

         ”Dan, go to bed.” Jack approached him, expression serious. “We can talk in the morning.”

         ”N—I-I gotta tell-tell you now, cause if I don’t—“

         ”Dan. Go to bed. Now.” Dan shrank back, body quivering at Jack’s tone of voice. A pang of guilt hit Jack’s heart. Did he really scare Dan that badly? Or—no, she did that to him.

         ”I-I… ‘m sorry...” Dan whimpered. Tears spilled from his eyes. “’m sorry… I didn’t mean to, ‘m sorry...” He leaned over, copious amounts of undigested alcohol flowing past his lips into the bucket. Jack’s joints locked up. What had he done? What had she done?! What did this mean for himself and Mandy?

         ”Dan.” A firm hand gripped Dan’s shoulder. “Hey. It’s okay. It’s okay. You’re not in trouble.” The tears slowly stopped flowing and Jack sighed in relief. “You need to go to sleep. You’ll feel better in the morning, okay?” Dan sniffled and nodded.

         ”’kay.” Dan slid down into a laying position, face pressed against fleece, and let out a strangled, anguished howl. “I try… I try so hard every day t’ keep going, Jack, and it’s not… it’s not working! I’m scared, I’m so scared all the time and I try to believe that if I’m good she’ll stop, she has to stop, she has to and that she has good in her somewhere, and—an’ I’m not even sure of that bu’ but it’s all I have, and I don’t—I don’t know anything anymore, but I—I wanna believe for my own sake, but it’s so hard, it’s so hard to keep believing an’ keep going but I have to, I have to… ‘nd then she went and dragged you both into this and I—uuu—I didn’ want anybody else to get hurt, I jus—I jus—uuuaaaahhhhHHH!” Dan broke down into intense heaving sobs. Mandy crawled over to him and rubbed his back.

         ”Dan? Dan, I need you to do something for me.” Mandy spoke quietly. “I need you to think of something happy, okay? Something good. Can you do that for me?”

         ”I-I...” Dan took a deep breath, breaking into a whimper. “...Y-Yeah, I can… I can try...”

         ”Good...” Mandy whispered softly in Dan’s ear, “Do you have something in mind?” Dan meekly nodded. “Will you tell us about it?”

         ”I… I remember… This one time… She said she loved me.” Mandy and Jack’s eyes met in a concerned glance. It was like a switch had been flipped in Dan’s mind. Dan’s lips curled into a small smile. “She said that… whenever she came to see me was the best part of her day, and seeing me here, waiting for her made her so happy inside...” Dan’s eyes brightened. “Tha’s why I wanted t’ know where you came from, ‘cause… ‘cause the ones who kidnapped me said… said I might end up with somebody who would—who would torture me to death. And I got here, and I was lucky. She wanted to love me. She wanted to love me. But I wouldn’t… I wouldn’t let her. I s-said such horrible things, awful things… But she—she still… She didn’t kill me, even though she could have, easily. She gave me this drawer to live in, she gave me a bed, she fed me… She gave me everything... I didn’t ask for anything and she gave me everything...”

         ”Dan, no.” Mandy shook her head. “No. Listen to yourself. She kidnapped you. She’s holding you—us—captive here. She took everything from you. Didn’t you have family? Friends?” Dan teared up.

         ”Y-Yes...” His Adam’s apple moved ever so slightly as he swallowed the lump in his throat. “Um… I h-had… have… um… parents. A-and an older sister.”

         ”Alright. Okay, good...” Jack settled down next to the two of them.

         ”None of that really matters now, though...” Dan quietly interjected. “See, you still have some fight in you. I’ll tell you one thing, and I hope you both take it to heart because I couldn’t bear to watch you suffer… Give up. Right now. Give up. We won’t escape. We can’t. Chances are if you try, or she catches either of you trying to convince me, she’ll… she’ll kill you. She told me so herself, long before she brought you here. She’ll eat you alive. I don’t want that. You don’t want that.” Dan got a little fervent. “Please, just try to be good. Being her pet isn’t… so bad… and… It could be a lot worse.” he bit his lip. “We get fed at least twice a day. Bathed regularly. Clothed. Bed to sleep on. Comfortable one, too… We’ve got free roam of this place, instead of being collared at the neck on a tether… She gives us things to do to pass the time, lets us sleep for however long we want… Some people would kill for this opportunity.”

         ”Some people would.” Mandy didn’t dispute that fact. “But you didn’t ask for this. It was forced on you, Dan.”

         ”Don’t do this. Please...” Dan begged. “Please… I-I’m h… happy with how things are now, that’s all that matters! It’s the way things are now. It’s the way things are always gonna be, and I wouldn’t dream of changing it. Please just leave it alone… Please?”

         ”Dan… What about your sister? Your parents? What about them? They’ve gotta be looking for you. They miss you. Are you just going to let them think you’re dead and never coming home because you’ve given up?!” Jack yelled in a whisper. He held no ill will against this man, truly, but it was quite apparent he was far from a rational state of mind.

         ”Th-That’s not fair, I didn’t—“

         ”ARE YOU?!” Jack pinned Dan to the floor, kneeling on his abdomen. Amanda curled her knees to her chest, eyes red and puffy as she helplessly watched the two men fighting. They shouldn’t go against each other like this, they should stick together! This was all her fault… She instigated this… This was all her fault...

         ”YES!” Dan roared, shoving Jack off of him in a herculean effort and rising to his feet. He let all his pent-up frustrations explode out in one string of uncharacteristic stress-triggered rage and vulgarity. “Don’t you FUCKING DARE come in here for one day and try to tell ME how to handle what I’ve been going through for WEEKS! Mandy sat on the pair of tights, idly shuffling a pack of playing cards and keeping her eyes trained on the dimly lit form of Dan on the opposite side of their enclosure. He was curled up on the ground with his back to her, breathing slowly. Jack leaned against one of the walls of the drawer, deep in thought. Mandy stood, managing two steps in Dan’s direction before being stopped by a hand clamping around her wrist.

         ”Let me go.” She stated much calmer than she’d expect, given the circumstances. “I said let me go, asshole.” She tried to tug her wrist from Jack’s grip. “I swear to God, Jack, let me go right now or I’ll scream. I will scream so fucking loud her neighbors will think she’s torturing a rabbit to death. And when she comes to shut me up, she’s gonna be pissed off. And y’know I think we should all stick together, but if we get in trouble because you didn’t take your hands off me, you bet damn well I’m gonna shift the blame on you. Last chance. Let. Me. Go.”

         ”I’d listen to her, Jack.” Both Amanda and Jack turned their attention to Dan, who hadn’t moved a muscle, though he had definitely said it. “She doesn’t want to punish us right now, that’s why we’re here alone. So, if you give her a reason to hand out discipline, you’ve royally fucked up. One of us gets punished, we ALL get punished. I don’t know about you, but I quite enjoy having all my bones intact. And don’t think for a second she’d be gentle because it’s your first time.” Dan’s heart raced in his chest. His body began to quiver almost instinctively at the idea of punishment. Broken bones, bent ribs, searing stakes of metal, half-drowning, suffocation... How little of a care she gave to his—now their—safety when disobedient was concerning to say the least. He wished she could do “normal” punishments like missing meals or having his bed taken away. It would be uncomfortable and take a mental toll on him, but it would be preferable to constant agony. Hell, he’d even be up for the humiliation of being spanked until he was red and crying like a five year old. It would suck hard, but at least it would be over sooner than searing pain every time he tried to breathe. “Let her go.”

         Jack’s grip on Mandy’s arm loosened. She hastily tore herself from his hold groaning something about him under her breath, taking long strides to Dan’s side. Dan didn’t roll over or even acknowledge her as she knelt next to him and ran her fingers down his spine.

         ”Dan...?” No response. “It’s gonna be okay. We’re here. We’re together, and we’re safe.” Mandy kissed him gently on the cheek. Dan froze. This was the first kiss he’d gotten in months that didn’t involve his chest being enveloped.

         ”Safe?” A bit of disdain couldn’t help but creep into his voice. “No. Least, not usually.”

         ”What’s it like? Being… here, I mean? Being a...” Amanda crawled over Dan, settling down on the sock so they were looking each other in the eyes.

         ”Pet? Sex slave?…. Just peachy.” Tears ran down Dan’s face as he laughed in discomfort.

         ”Oh, you’re crying!! Th-that’s okay, w-we—we don’t have to talk about that if you don’t want!”

         ”No—no, no, it’s… She fuckin’ brought you here because she thought I was gonna be lonely!” Dan wiped his tears with the heel of his hand. “It’s all my fault, Mandy, it’s—if I hadn’t been so weak, then—B-But don’t worry, ha! I-I’m sure that in a couple months I’ll b-be totally adjusted, I’ll be happy when she’s happy and she won’t hurt me anymore because I’ll be good!” He panted, almost like he was choking on something. “Right?!?!” A guttural noise of discomfort exited his throat. “I could never let my parents or my sister know, b-because—I know they can’t help me. A-and I got myself into this mess. I did, really. I’m… I’m not going to have those I love the most risk their lives to save me, because chances are, they’re not even going to succeed! I’d rather they live their lives without me than have them crushed into smears because I was too selfish to put their safety first!” Dan coughed. “A-Anyway, it’s not… so bad, I guess. U-Usually um, you sit here and wait. She’ll come get us when she needs us for meals, or baths, or...” He swallowed hard, getting a strange, almost mournful look in his eyes. “S-Sex. A-And um, even that’s just… If she’s giving it, just lay there and take it. If she’s getting it, she’ll tell you what she needs. So far, she’s been gracious enough to not use me as a…” Dan paused, his mouth unwilling to form the word. “Just try to keep your wits about you, remember it’ll be over soon enough, and above all, watch your tongue. That’s how I got this.” He gingerly rubbed the burn on his abdomen. “I mouthed off and she was having none of it. Uh… Last of all I guess is, she gives us stuff to do when she’s not using us. Saw you messing with some cards earlier, she gives us paper and pencils, personally I’ve been keeping a journal, mmm… and… I think I may have sweet talked her into getting a TV and a gaming console in here. I’d kill for a smoke, though. The stress is driving me mad.” The nails of his index finger and thumb quietly clicked together and Mandy suddenly noticed the cuticles of all his fingers were picked raw.

         ”Dinnertime!” All three of her captives nearly jumped out of their skins as plates with chunks of waffles and bacon clattered to the ground. Jack and Mandy watched Dan in trepidation as he approached the food and began to eat as if nothing was wrong. Giving into their hunger seeing as the food was apparently safe, the other two quickly followed suit. “Good! You’re learning! Wait… What’s that smell?” Dan, Jack, and Mandy froze, exchanging nervous glances.

         ”U-Um… Dan drank too much. B-But don’t worry! He made sure he made it to a bucket first.” Jack hurriedly explained, stealing a glance at Dan, who had gone completely rigid.

         ”Dan?” asked Anna, pulling the bottle cap filled with acrid vomit out of the drawer.

         ”Y...Yeah?”

         ”Slow down a little, okay?”

         ”Okay...” He mumbled, Mandy, Jack, and himself breathing a collective sigh of relief. Anna gave them all a contented little smile and left them to finish their meal.

         ”… Hey Dan?” Jack tapped his index fingers together idly.

         ”Yeah?”

         ”M’sorry about what I said before. We… We all react to stress in different ways, y’know?”

         ”I know.” He took a bite of bacon. “So how was your first day as a human hamster?”

         ”It was… Definitely something.” Jack confirmed.

         ”You haven’t seen anything yet. On my… first day… It was so bad I uh…” He wasn’t sure he wanted to give up the embarrassing details. “I pissed myself.” Dan stacked the empty plates together and stood up. “I still can’t believe there are people who would want this. And someday, if she gets her hands on someone who does, I want to meet them. Maybe just to pick their brain apart. They’d probably love it here...”

         ”Well...” Amanda stretched with an air of finality, refusing to dwell on the disturbing idea any longer. “I’m about ready to turn in for the night. Aren’t you, Jack?”

         ”Yeah… And if what Dan tells us is true, then… We’re gonna need a lot of sleep.”

         ”I’ve got clothes you can wear until she gets more. We’re about the same size, right Jack?” Dan rifled through a pile. “Here.” A white t-shirt and plaid pajama bottoms were thrust into Jack’s arms. “And… Here.” He handed Mandy a black shirt with a decal on it, the name of some band she didn’t recognize. “Promise I won’t look.” Dan covered his eyes.

          “Done.” Mandy and Jack said, a moment’s lapse between each confirmation.

         ”Whoa Mandy, you look… so...” Dan murmured. The shirt was easily 2 times too big on her frame, sleeves hanging to her elbows and the bottom hem reaching past her thighs.

         ”So...” Jack joined in.

         ”Cute!” The two men gushed at the adorable sight. Mandy rolled her eyes.

         ”Anyway, um, we basically sleep wherever we want. I’m partial to the tights, and there’s plenty of room. If you get cold, cover up with whatever you find, she doesn’t care.” Dan settled down, watching the other two follow suit. He had a feeling they’d sleep deeply tonight.

Thump. Thump. Thump. Thump.

         Dan cracked an eye open. The strange pounding came in sets of two, like… footsteps. Squinting in the darkness, he could just barely make out a human outline. Jack. He hadn’t slept, instead spending the wee hours of the morning anxiously pacing across the floor and it sounded like he was holding in tears.

         "What is it?"

         "Try to stop thinking about it. If we all just stick together like Mandy said, and do what we're told, we'll be fine... Right? Dan?" Dan didn't respond, his eyes shut tight as he feigned sleep. "Okay. Guess we'll talk in the morning."

A half a slice of toast with margarine and a thimble of water quickly followed. Dan's mouth began to water, and a more rational part of him silently cursed himself for responding like a damn dog. "I hope you all eat enough. You're gonna need energy for what I have planned."

         "I don't know." Dan interjected bitterly. "N-No one from outside can help me, I know it. I-If she even finds out I made this phonecall, she'll--" Dan's panic was rising again. "Gh... How long have I been gone?"

         "Y-You've been... gone for a few months, at least! Dan, what happened?!" She tried her best to keep calm. Her baby boy was out there somewhere, terrified, alone...

         "M-Months...?" Dan whimpered, nearly dropping the phone.

         "W-We had just assumed you had run off somewhere... It's not like you, but you're an adult, and--"

         "I was kidnapped." He said solemnly, eyes vacantly staring at the ground.

         "C-Call the police! O-Or... I could! Th-They can track your GPS and find you!"

         "No." Dan lamented, hopelessness overflowing. "No they won't. They couldn't. Trust me on that... It's not someplace that can be tracked... It's a miracle I even managed to get service."

         "Daniel, listen to me." Her voice was shaking, but her words were stern. "I am your mother. Let me help you."

         "NO!" Dan cried. His heart threatened to exit his chest. "Y-You don't know what it's been like. You don't know what I've been through." Trembling fear had fully entered his voice as his pain and suffering was fully mentally recounted. "You don't know what they are. These... things... They're not human, they're... They're monsters."

         "What--N-no, no! They are monsters! Like--"

         "Like... Movie... monsters? A-are you serious?"

         "Yes!" Dan breathed, overwhelmed, "I wouldn't lie to you. Not about something like this. Please... Please. You have to believe me... I-I don't know how or why, but... They exist. They took me away and I never..."

Thump.

Dan nearly pissed his pants.

         "Dan, what was that?!"

The drawer began to slide open, bringing his captor into full view.

         "Sh-She's here..." Dan whispered hurriedly. "I-I..." His voice cracked. "I have to go. I love you and Dad so... so much..." Dan was crying. He didn't want to let go. He didn't want to give it up. "N-No..." He whimpered. Anna was staring down at him, face twisted in disapproval.

         "What's happening?! Dan, what do you see?!" His mother cried in concern. She wouldn't give up on her son. There was no way. She heard his phone clatter to the ground, followed by a stranger indistinctly questioning and reprimanding him. Dan started apologizing to the stranger. Something brushed against the receiver, like there was a fight. Dan screamed in absolute terror. "Dan?! DAN?!"

Click.

Dan's eyes widened, but he diverted them to the floor, ultimately deciding it would be best to ignore what he just saw.

         "Just... Never do this again." She lifted the phone out of the drawer, careful not to damage it in any way. "...nd... If you behave, I might give the phone back later." Dan's mouth fell open, quickly curling into a smile of joy.

         "Good. Don't think this means you've gotten out of a punishment, though. And don't make me regret allowing this. Because if you do, I will break this phone into a million pieces and I'll be the only person you'll ever hear or see again, understand?"

         "Y-Yes!"

         "Oh. And one last thing. If anyone shows up here in some misguided rescue attempt, I'm holding you personally responsible." Dan jumped at that. Anna, meanwhile, gently slid Dan's phone into a small sparkly cardboard box which contained a few of his other belongings. "What would be a suitable punishment for you? I could break your legs..." Dan sat down, curling his legs tightly to his chest. "I could make you stand outside in the snow and count to 10,000... You wouldn't run, snow's too deep for that. Hmm... Do tinies have sex toys?" Dan was sweating bullets. He considered the least damaging thing he would be willing to do to appease her.

         "I have an idea..." Anna walked out of Dan's sight and unzipped a tote bag, retrieving a long, black drawstring pouch. Inside the pouch was a ribbed wand made of pure glass. She roughly grabbed Dan, forcibly stripping his clothes as he whimpered and yelped.

         "I could have done it myself..." He quietly complained under his breath. He found himself slammed against the glass for that comment. "Ow! That really--ugh!" She contorted Dan's arms behind his back to the point they threatened to pop from the shoulder joint. After getting his wrists to touch around the circumference of the dildo, she secured him in place with a small rubber band. Dan screamed, only to have a mouthful of flesh quickly silence him. It felt like his shoulders were nearly torn off.

         "Please don't scream. I thought we had moved past this." She hushed him gently, affixing his ankles in the same manner. "No one is going to hear you, so I'd rather you not give yourself a sore throat for no reason."

         "This really hurts..." Dan mewled.

         "Well obviously. It wouldn't be much of a punishment if it didn't." She slid her legs open, leaving Dan staring up at the naked white ceiling. "You're gonna fuck me good and hard, understand?" Dan closed his eyes, silently resigning himself to his fate. "Hm... actually, I've got a better idea." Anna dangled the glass wand upside down as she walked. Dan was still attached to the wand. "Come on, we're going on a little trip." Picking up a plastic box just big enough to fit the dildo inside, she wandered out into the backyard.

         The yard was covered in a solid two feet of crunchy snow that barely yielded when Anna threw the box onto it. Dan was placed inside. The bright blue sky spread across the entire world only served to mock him. His ears perked up at an ear-grating sound that he could feel in his teeth, like someone was dragging a shovel across concrete.

         "What are you doing?!" The fear and trepidation was incredibly evident in his voice as he watched her shovel away piles of white powder.

         "Well..." The shovel hit the nearly frozen ground with a thunk, picking up a solid mass of earth, "As you can see, I'm digging a hole."

         Why?! What for?!"

         "You'll see." The overturned dirt piled up quickly, soon leaving a two foot hole in the ground, not including the mountain of snow that would be piled on top of it. The box was pushed none-too-gently into the hole. "If my math is right, you'll have eight hours of oxygen, max. I'd advise you don't panic, and try to take shallow breaths."

         "What...?"

Feeling precious air slip away with every breath, the stifling carbon dioxide making you choke... Buried alive... Must be pretty awful."

Nausea pulsed through him, he knew that was exactly the case. She'd touch herself tonight to the thought of Dan alone, scared, and screaming. She clicked the top of the box into place. The top was clear, so Dan could be tormented with shovel after shovel of dirt taking his light away in his premature--possibly permanent--burial. His scream was tortured and ear-piercing. It was so loud, by the time she had covered the entire hole and was preparing to pack down the dirt, Anna could still hear it.

         "SHUT THE FUCK UP!" She snapped, firmly stamping the hole. The scream broke down into silence. She piled the snow on top. It was freezing outside. With Dan successfully buried and silent, Anna dragged the shovel to the garage, anxious to get back in the house to relieve herself.

He was choking. He couldn't see. He couldn't breathe. He was dying. Dan couldn't get his wrists undone from the straps holding him down. Even if he could, he wouldn't be able to escape. Two feet of dirt on him may as well be closer to thirty. He was stuck. Dan screamed in frustration and fear, beginning to hyperventilate against his better judgement.

         "God... She's finally gotten bored of me and this is how I die..." He wept, shivering violently. Dan's tears froze on his face. He could feel the subzero temperature in the cores of his teeth. His lips, fingertips, and toes had long gone numb. The glass, giving him no insulation, only made matters worse. "Haha... Hahahaha... Gh... I really fucked up this time... But y'know what?" Dan said, quietly to himself, "I don't regret it. No, I... I'm glad I called. Sh-She would have done this anyway, I bet... Yeah... She wouldn't have stopped. Twisted fuck..." Dan imagined her sprawled across her bed, fingering herself to orgasm as she imagined him trapped, alone, and afraid. He imagined his mother, sobbing in the arms of his father and gripping the phone white-knuckled while his father tried to convince her to call the police. Ice-cold air prickled his skin and Dan even began to imagine Anna's tights, where it was at least soft and warm. He could have stayed there, he could be wrapped up in fleece, comfortable and toasty. Instead, he had chosen wrong. Yes. That was the truth. Dan thought. I made a choice and I chose wrong. Dan struggled with the straps again, hoping to at least be able to soothe the cramps in his limbs and curl up to conserve body heat.

         Finally with a snap, the rubber band broke against his skin, cutting into his wrists and leaving a thin trail of blood along the glass. His legs quickly followed. Dan sighed with near orgasmic relief as he let his arms go limp and let his muscles relax. Dan traced his tongue around his wrists, collecting up the blood and swallowing it. He curled into himself and his teeth chattered. Would he even make it until morning? How long had he been stuck in here? Dan suddenly had an extreme case of claustrophobia. Stale air weighed on his chest. I can't breathe... I'm going to die, I can't breathe... The darkness and weight started to smother him. It felt like he was breathing nothing but clots of the surrounding dirt directly into his lungs. Dan coughed up mud. The sound of worms crawling outside reminded him how deep down he really was.

         "There's no way she'd... actually do this... No. No, no, no...." He ran his fingers through his hair. "There's no way she'd actually... Leave me here to die, no. She's-She's too obsessed with me to actually let me die in here." Dan reassured himself. "Yeah... Yeah. Just have to make it until morning and she'll come get me. Yeah. She'll come get me... He drifted off to sleep with the quiet notion that he may not wake up again. "Save me, Anna!!! PLEASE! SAVE ME!" Dan woke up screaming in the dark, unabashedly begging for comfort from the only person he'd had contact with in who knows how long. "Anna! Save... S-s-save me... Anna... Please..." His hands wouldn't stop shaking, not even as the light cracked through the box, nor when his frozen stiff form was rattled around. Anna tucked him under her arm and took Dan inside. "Th-Thank you... Thank you so much..."

         "Mornin', sleepyhead." She said in that same shy tone as always, placing Dan into a warm sinkful of water.

         "W-Wait, what if I have hypo--"

         "You don't have hypothermia." Dan moaned quietly as her fingers ran over him, soothing his frost-covered body and aching muscles. "You can't get hypothermia. Just trust me. And if you did? You'd already be dead."

         "Oh..." Dan rubbed his stiff shoulders. "U-Um... It..." Don't say it. Don't say it. Don't you dare-- "It felt really good when you sort of... massaged me like that... I-If you wanted to, you could--"

         "What's this all of a sudden?" She cocked her head. "Thought you said you hated me. " I do. Dan meekly shrugged his shoulders. Filthy traitor. "That time in the ground really freaked you out, huh?" Before he could think, his head bobbed up and down and he started to daydream about Anna's home-cooked food and her soft, warm tights to sleep in... "Well, we can fix that, okay?" She carried Dan off into her room after drying and dressing him. She placed him sitting on top of the dresser. "Okay. You ready? I've been planning this for a long time..." She unwrapped a tiny 1/2 inch needle normally meant for a mouse. She hoped this size wouldn't kill him. A tiny clear drop of liquid sat in the base of the syringe.

         "What is that?!" Anna pinched Dan's arm and forced him down. "What is that?!

         "Stop squirming." She commanded firmly, jabbing the needle into soft tissue and depressing the plunger. "Now sit still. What's done is done."

         "Wha... What is that? What're you doing to me?" Dan sobbed and slumped over where he was sitting. There was no point in fighting back now. It was already inside him, pumping its way through his bloodstream and working its dirty magic.

         "I wouldn't tell you, of course, but they'd hardly notice it's missing. For a tiny guy like you? It took a few drops for a regimen of a few weeks." Dan couldn't help but feel like she was bragging. "Oh! Looks like we're almost there!" Dan was finding it hard to keep his eyes open.

         "Wh-wh're...y'...gon'... d'..t'me..." Dan slurred out before he collapsed. Anna propped him up against a book and wondered how she could hypnotize him.

Not one of his "journal entries", but she had left those out as well, should he try to read them. She returned to Dan scrawling on the paper. "Oh? What're you drawing?" Dan gave her a lopsided smile.

         "Look, look!" he urged as he took his juice. On the page was a drawing of himself, simple. Balls for hands, rectangular body, blue dots for eyes. He was standing in a meadow. Blue sky, yellow sun, pink flowers dotting the grass. Next to him were three figures, a woman and man on the left and a woman on the right. Childish orange-crayon scrawl dictated who they were from left to right. "FRANKIE", a woman about Dan's age, with long dark hair and glasses. "DAD", an older man who resembled Dan but with white hair, "ME", Dan himself, and "MUM" an older woman with blonde hair.

         "It's very good, Danny. Mind if I keep it for later?" Dan nodded enthusiastically, flattered. Anna slid it into the box with his other possessions.
