Dan rolled over, vomiting down the front of his new clothes. This was the worst hangover he’d ever had. He didn’t remember drinking, though, or even going to bed. The light sent a surge of pounding pain through his skull as he cracked his eyes open. Wait a second… These aren’t the clothes I went to sleep in. At least... I don’t think... Dan cringed in disgust when the vomit began to seep through the fabric of his shirt. He hurriedly pulled off the dark grey zip hoodie and fumbled his way out of his black t-shirt. He prayed Anna wouldn’t be too upset about his getting puke on the floor. Maybe he could mop it up before she noticed.

         With his chest now bare, he took a closer look. No, there was no way he had fallen asleep in this. He would remember if he did. There’s no way he’d even accidentally fall asleep in converse and jeans. The only logical explanation is that Anna had changed his clothes at some point. But why? At least he was back in the drawer with actual sources of heat and comfort instead of buried in the backyard. Dan briefly glanced upwards and caught sight of her coming. His eyes darted around in panic and he fought nausea as he frantically scrubbed up vomit with his already stained wolf-print shirt.

         ”I-I—I didn’t mean to, I swear!” Dan blurted. “P-please don’t be mad at me, I didn’t mean to--”

         ”I know, baby..." She said with a perverted sweetness. "So, how’s the headache?”

         ”H-How did you know I...?”

         ”I know lots of things, Danny. For example, it’s February 7th. Not January like you think.”

         ”N-No... No, you've gotta be... St-stop fucking with me!” Dan shouted. “I-I-It’s only... January... Right?”

         ”Nope, sweetie. You’re wrong. Your mother must be worried sick, calling her like that then not following up for how many weeks.” Dan’s head spun. What if she was telling the truth? Where had all that lost time gone?! “Maybe this time when you call, your Daddy and sister will be there too!” She scooped Dan into her hands.

         ”I-I n-never said I had--”

         ”Yes you did.” She slid him the childish picture. “Right there, see?” Dan’s eyes widened in horror. Her name was written right there, plain as day.

         ”I-I d... don’t remember making this…”

         ”Don’t you?” She turned on her digital camera and pressed “PLAY”.

         ”Mm? Wha’re these?” Dan watched his body act like a toddler, scribbling on a piece of of paper. “Look, look!” Not-Dan squealed like a young child. He pushed the picture that he drew towards Anna. Real-Dan covered his mouth as the exact picture he was holding came into view.

         ”No...” he whispered. “You’re-You’re lying, you have to be, there’s no way I’d...”

         ”Frankie’s her name, isn’t it?” Dan nodded dumbly. “So what’s it a nickname for? Francesca? Francis?” She immediately swapped topics. “You know your vomiting? Nausea?”

         ”... Yeah?” Dan mumbled, 100 percent certain he didn’t want to hear what she had to say.

         ”It’s drug withdrawal!” She grinned cheerfully. “Oh, oh, oh! I had made a deal with myself earlier. I think you’ll want to hear it.” She took a deep breath. “I can put you right back into that state whenever the fuck I want. So I think you should try to follow orders a little more now, ‘kay?” Dan gulped.

         ”L-Like what?”

         ”Weeellll… I was thinkin’ about how you haven’t called your parents in a few weeks... What if we dialed them up right now? I’m sure they’d love to meet me.” Dan shuddered to think of how this monster cunt would break down his mother and father using words. “Let’s make it a game! You give me their number, and I’ll call. I’m good at pretending, you’ll see! You’ll be getting me off, or under my ass. Your parents will never be the wiser! C’mon it’ll be funny, and… kinda sexy... having somebody on the phone have no idea you’ve got their precious little boy buried under your ass...” She scraped a fingernail under Dan’s chin and pulled out her phone, “Now... Give me their number.” Anna slipped off her jeans and reclined on the bed, pushing her panties to the side.

         ”No... I-I... I refuse.” Dan mustered up his last ounces of courage. He couldn’t let his parents hear such a thing...

         ”Okay, Danny, say “Mother”.” An inexplicable wave of dread washed over Dan. Sinking to his knees, Dan relented, if only to make the feeling go away.

         Ring...

         Ring...

         Click.

         ”Hello?” Came a familiar voice. Anna had put it on speaker and suppressed a giggle when Dan buried himself further into her labial folds to avoid an outburst.

         ”Oh... You must be Dan’s mother.”

         ”Y-Yes, who is this?”

         ”What if I—ahn—told you I know... exactly where your son is?”

         ”I-I... I don’t believe you. Do you really?!”

         ”Mmhm!”

         ”Where? Please, tell me where...”

         ”He’s in my cunt.”

         ”... What?”

         ”I said he’s in my cunt. Would you like me to show you?”

         “Y-You’ve got a real twisted sense of humor, you know that?!” Dan’s mother angrily reprimanded. Anna continued as if nothing had happened.

          “Dan, come here—COME HERE!” She forcibly dragged him out as he kicked and struggled.

         ”No... No...” Dan mewled pathetically. She can’t see me in this state... She can’t...

         ”Now smile for the camera!” Dan’s battered and bruised upper body was immortalized on the phone. A faint ping came from Dan’s mother’s end. The horrific scream that followed was indescribable.

         ”D-Dan, Daniel, Wh-what--” She was having trouble forming words through tears.

         "D-Don't listen to her, please... Don't listen..." Dan wailed. "Don't!"

         ”I fuck Dan every day whether he wants it or not.” Anna taunted, her voice unhinged and raspy, as though she had been taken over by a demon, “He does what I say, because if he doesn’t, he dies! Even today, right now, he begged, pleaded with me to stop, but I didn’t. You know what his calling you—you know what that punishment was?! I buried him alive. He almost froze to death, alone and afraid. Ahaha! Another time I almost crushed him to death under my cunt! I almost cracked all his ribs and smushed him right into paste! Dan spends every single night in my underwear drawer wishing he were dead. Crying for you. Begging for you. “Mommy, mommy please save me!”” Anna mockingly sobbed. “Hah! Some man you raised... He’s crying like a little bitch right now, as a matter of fact. He’s gonna spend the rest of his pathetic excuse for a life as my slave, and there’s nothing you can do about it! And now? He’s about to start worshiping the ground I walk on, because if he doesn’t, I’ll personally round up your entire family and have my fun with all of you. And the last time you ever see little Danny alive again is right before I send you squirming down my throat. Hey... hey—If you think that first picture was bad, just you wait... ”

         ”Someone’s going to find you.” Dan’s mother’s voice shook with rage. “I’ll send them out myself. I hope they SEND YOU TO HELL WHERE YOU BELONG!”

         ”Ooh, threatening a monster. What a good idea.” Anna mocked.

         ”I swear to God you bitch, if you lay another hand on my son...”

         ”You’ll what? He tried to warn you, you know. I really am a monster. If you’re smart, you’ll go back on everything you just said. And if you’re not, well... I’d like to see you try and find me. It’ll be fun feeling you squish under my toes. Oh. And Dan’s not your son anymore. He’s my little fuck-toy now.”

"Dan... who is this?" A squirming, sobbing woman was held aloft by her sides, just out of Dan's reach. "I found her wandering around outside, looking terribly lost, not to mention out of place. She's far too clean and well-dressed to be a filthy feral..."

         "D... Dan?"

         "Oh my God..." Dan slid a hand over his mouth, partially from shock, partially to stop any unfortunate regurgitation. "Frankie... You came... You actually came..."

         "So you do know her, huh?"

         "Sh-she's..." Dan's lips trembled slightly as he whimpered out his statements, "Sh-she's my sister, please Anna, no... H-have mercy just this once, I'll do anything, ANYTHING, j-just don't hurt her, please..." Dan collapsed to his hands and knees, fingers intertwined tightly to stop the tremors. "I-I'll love you as much as you want, yeah?" He tried to flash a sultry smile, but was betrayed by reddened, tear-filled eyes. "Sh-She can live here too, with me--with us. I-I-I'll teach her to be good... to be a good pet... We'll be good from now on, okay? J-Just let her... I'll... I-I'll..." Tears splattered against wood and all that could be heard were Frankie's panicked sobs.

         "You know, Frankie..." Anna directed her full attention to the terrified woman, "You're awfully lucky I found you out there, y'know? Cats and owls are outside, just waiting for easy prey like you to come along... Did Dan know that, or did he just recklessly ask you to risk your life for him?" Frankie swallowed hard, trying to collect her wits in a horrific situation.

         "N-N-No... I-I-I j-just heard that he was trapped and w-wanted to s-save him--help him, I m-mean." Frankie performed a last second word swap out of fear. What would their captor do if she found out Dan wanted to be "saved" from her? "I-I-I-I d-didn't hear anything a-about g-giants or b-being tiny, or--I just wanna take my brother home..."

         "Okay." Her tone was just above a whisper. She gently slid the pad of her thumb over Frankie's face to keep her quiet. "Okay."

         "P-Please, Anna..." Dan mustered the courage to pathetically attempt to bargain again, "Y-You said it yourself, you're not a t-total monster... Show that to me now, huh? Sh-Show it to me and I'll do anything. Anything at all. Please... I'll never try to run again, I won't contact anyone else. Please... You want more pets? She walked right into your hands. A-And..." Dan swallowed back the excruciating scratchiness of his throat as he played a game of life and death, "A-And I was the one who called her here. Sh-She just wanted to help me. You're a smart woman, Frankie's innocent, if anyone should be punished it should be me! Punish me! PUNISH ME!!" Dan screamed in terror and rage and malaise. He'd take any beating she could dish out if it meant his sister could go unharmed.

         "Can you hear me, Frankie...?" Anna whispered, almost sultry in tone. "Is this what you want? Are you willing to give up your former life to be my pet, huh? Are you willing to throw everything away for the sake of your brother? He wants to be punished in your place, and he knows how rough I can get... That's quite a sacrifice, I'd say. He wants me to give you a chance to be mine, like he is. Is that what you want?"

         "N-N-No..." Frankie stammered meekly. "N-No, b-but I can... I can learn! J-Just p-please, please, don't hurt my brother, i-i-it's not his fault! I--"

         "But it is his fault. See, he dragged you into this. You're pretty. Smart. Probably have a good career, friends, maybe even a boyfriend, but that didn't matter to Danny. See? He didn't care about everything you'd leave behind. He didn't care about how risky it was. He just wanted, and wanted, and wanted, and sucked all his loved ones down into a pit they couldn't escape from. Isn't that awful?" Anna idly twisted the ball of her foot as she hung herself over the drawer. "So that's why I'm going to do this. To prove a point. To both of you." A thin, wicked smile spread across Anna's lips as the air filled with the hysterical incoherent cries and Dan's maddening screams of impotent rage, helplessness, and terror.

         "Gh..." He squeezed his eyes shut and fought tears of his own. "You're okay. We're both okay. We're gonna be just fine, don't worry..." He stared up at his captor over his sister's shoulder, smoldering hate brewing in his eyes. "She doesn't deserve this. Why couldn't you just let her go home? She wouldn't have told anyone."

         "Hm. It's strange how you're talking like that when you know just how badly this could have backfired in your fucking face. She wouldn't be here at all if you hadn't gone out of your way to try and contact your fucking family."

His mouth ran faster than his brain could hope to process. "God, no..." The words reverberated in his ears as he finally figured what he had said. Humming pleasantly to herself, she slid open the sparkly silver box and picked up Dan's first and last hope for any real escape. "You'll never try to leave me ever again." Anna's lower lip pouted slightly and her gaze locked front-and-center on Dan and Frankie in that wide, twitching, abhorrent stare. "Look at me. Dan, look at me." She chastised like a kindergarten teacher. "Listen." The crunch of metal and glass was palpable, minute shards of what was left of the phone tinkling to the floor. "Now..." a chilling contralto rattled in her throat, "If you misbehave again, I may have to break... Something else..." She pinched his arm between her index finger and thumb.

         "Let go!" Dan clawed desperately at his arm. Frankie stumbled back and started to sob. "Let go!"

Despite everything, he sighed in relief. If Anna grew to enjoy having Frankie around... Maybe things could change... 1231111222111211121211212212211122111.content:
"No... This can't be real, we have to be dreaming!"

         Dan and Frankie sat huddled together in the drawer, a cheap flashlight illuminating what little there was to see around them. Dan had obtained some tape and hung pictures scrawled in paint and colored pencil against the walls. Some were bright depictions of the outside world, fields, cities, farms. Others were garish nonsensical explosions of color. Anything to stave off the insanity of being trapped in a drawer with blank walls all day like a mental patient in a padded cell.

It didn't work.

         "Be quiet, she's going to hear you." Dan hushed his sister gently. His mind was alight and racing with the worst possible fates in store for him. He knew his tormentor... "lover" could think of a million ways to torture him plus a few more, the product of a sick mind filled to the brim with morbid creativity. "I'm... I'm so sorry, Frankie... This is all my fault. If I hadn't... If I hadn't been so selfish, you'd... I should have just been content being alone... Now... Now not only are we both trapped here forever, our parents are..."

         "Do you think they're looking for us?"

         "M-Maybe, but... God knows we're never gonna see them again..." Dan moved his lips quietly, "They probably think we're both dead. Losing both kids in the span of a couple months..." His face twisted into a scowl of teeth-cracking rage, "How could she do something like this?!"

No, wait. As much as he wanted to, he couldn't entirely place the blame on her. It was all of them. Their entire system.

         "Dan?" That unforgettable voice, forever ingrained into his mind, asked from above.

         A soft whimper of terror croaked from Dan's throat. Frankie began to scream, but quickly clamped her hand over her mouth before it reached fruition. She gripped Dan tightly and he reacted in kind, both attempting to cover the other's weaknesses. Dan had Frankie in a death grip, muscles trembling with its ferocity. His entire body locked into a rigid state, refusing to move in the slightest no matter how much he was poked or prodded. It seemed to be an involuntary action.

         The fabric of Frankie's jeans grew damp with tears dripping down the decline of Dan's face as he kept his eyes trained on the ground with fierce intensity. He refused to look up. No matter how their captor attempted to goad him into it, he resisted.

         "No, no, no, no, not now, please, not now..." Vivid recollection of an aching skull, bent ribs, unwanted sexual conduct, agony, anguish, terror, tore into him over and over and over and over in his head with every throb of his pulse.

         "Dan..." Anna pouted rather theatrically, nearly mocking him, "You said if I spared your sister, you'd love me as much as I wanted, remember? Or..."

         Dan shuddered. Her tone twisted into something more hostile, her gaze more disgusted and accusatory as though she were looking at disease-ridden vermin, not her beloved pet boyfriend.

         "Were you lying to me?" She drew out the word "lying" in a choking hiss. "Ooh... I don't like liars..."

         "N... No! N-No, no! I wasn't lying! I wasn't lying!" Dan rushed out with a trembling voice crack that left it out in the open how scared he really was. "I wasn't lying! I..." Dan struggled to catch his breath, "I just--I..."

         "Spit it out. Or am I gonna have to turn you into a mindless dog again?!"

         "Ijustwasn'tready!"

         "You weren't ready? You weren't ready to love me?" Anna snorted derisively, laying her palm down on the floor of the drawer. "Well you had better be ready now. I don't like liars, and I especially don't like waiting for immediate promises to come to fruition. I'd think you'd be more diligent about your end of this, considering what's at stake..." Her gaze shifted to Frankie for a split second, but it was all Dan needed to be spurred on. He hastily pushed her onto the giant hand. Dan clenched his fist so hard his knuckles popped. As he and his sister were slowly raised out of the drawer, Dan's hand uncurled. All his hate... Anger... Strife... He drew his arm back and slapped Anna with everything he had left in him. Its sharp sound resonated through the empty room while its sharp sensation stung the palm of his hand.

         "Keep away from my sister you f--!"

         "You don't think before you act very often, do you?" Anna placed a fingertip on Dan's head and shoved him backwards. "You brought your sister here, became a liar who lies about lying... No wonder no one but her came to rescue you, you're garbage. You don't slap someone you swore to love."

         "I... I'm... so sorry." Dan hesitated just a moment. "I will love you. Forever, until the day I die. However you want. Th-that is what I promised, after all..." He murmured under his breath, "and I... I don't have much of a choice now, do I?

         "No, you don't!" She grinned wide. "I'm your source of food, water, entertainment, medical care, hygiene, and toilet privilege. So unless you want to live as a lice-ridden mangy toothless vermin, stay in line. We're gonna have some fun now."

         Dan's face blanched and he broke into a cold sweat as his memories of the last time they had "fun" came flooding back. He reached over and squeezed Frankie's hand protectively. Dan held her tight as they were carelessly dumped onto the mattress.

         "What's she gonna do to us?" Frankie whimpered. A strangled moan of discomfort exited Dan's throat as he bit his lip as hard as he could.

         "I'm bored. Distract me." Anna laid on her stomach and kept her attention on the computer monitor in front of her. Dan and Frankie remained stranded on the other end of the bed near her feet. She paid them no mind, not like they could get very far.

         "... What do you want us to do?" Dan mumbled.

         "I dunno. Figure something out." Anna idly flexed her toes. An electric bolt of pleasure shot up her leg into her pelvis as a pair of tiny hands pressed into her foot's sole. "Nnh... the fuck are you doing?"

         Dan didn't respond, giving Frankie a small nod to follow his lead. A sharp exhale came from above as their captor dug her fingers into the mattress and buried her face in her arms.

         "Hh... It... f-feels... Hah... It... feels... so... nngh..." Anna's toes squirmed and a small damp patch seeped through her panties. "D-Don't... Don't stop..." She bit her hand, attempting to keep it in. "O-One of you is gonna... Nnh--have to come up here an...d--ahn--finish me off." Her fingers clawed the bedsheets in desperation.

Dan and Frankie exchanged a worried glance.

         "Y-You can choose among yourselves but nnhh--hurry up or I'm doing it myself! I need it... so bad... I might just take both of you..."

He had to get away. But how? His foot slipped into a crevice. That was how. He’d hide. Bide his time until the monster put the bag down or emptied its contents to look for him, then make a run for it while she was distracted. Dan quickly and carefully sunk down into the recesses of the bag, taking care to make sure nothing would collapse on top of him and crush him to death. He found himself uncomfortably wedged between an amber vial and a tube of chapstick, but sighed in relief. He was out of sight and safe, for now.

13122.content:
Down to an arctic fox, but who exactly are you?

Name: Celeste
Age: 17
Background: For many years you had gone free and safe from the heartships so slavery, in no short part because of your secret hideaway deep in the taiga. However, at the relatively young age of 16, you had been found and taken from your homeland to a much warmer climate, your thick snow white fur causing you to sweat constantly. Kept in a grimy cage with the rest of your anthro kind, your fur had dulled and darkened, leaving you in a right state.

However, as a mistress entered the slave auction, you knew today may just be your day, for better or for worst....
13122.title: Celeste The Arctic Fox?

131221.content:
Authors note: You have been in that cage for almost a whole year since you were captured, something I forgot to include and may have confused the age. You are at this time 17. Also, since I plan on continuing this story for a while, if a choice says reserved, please do not add to it, for I have many plans for this story

In the poorly lit room behind the counter of the slave auction, you could only watch as people came and went, taking all sorts of slaves for their own doings, however never choosing you. Like you could blame them; your perfect fur was all matted and dirty from the horrible conditions you were forced to live in, making you look like a worn mut compared to some of the newer slaves. However, from your spot you noticed a young woman, cape drawn over her as she entered the building. You had seen her once or twice before, taking a young rabbit and an older cat. As her eyes spied the backroom, you noticed a glisten in them, looking directly at you. She turned to the clerk, clearing her throat.

"That...arctic fox is it? How long has she been here?" she started, her voice calm and neutral.

The clerk snickered as he looked back at you. He was one of the worst there, having abused you multiple times, causing you to reflexively cower at the mere sight of him. "Her? Pfff probably 17 or 18. Dirty old thing hasn't sold yet. Looking to buy her?"

The woman seemed to have noticed your movements, hearing her cough a few times as she returned herself, something being very off about her. "Is that a problem? I could always go to the other auction in the next town, I'm sure they'd be happy to-"

"Whoa whoa whoa, excuse me ma'am, I meant no disrespect to you."

"Maybe not to me...anyway, yes I was looking to purchase her for my farm. May I...take a closer look?" she mused, seeing her smirk a bit.

"W-Why of course, come with me."

You could only watch as the clerk lifted the entrance to the back of the counter, watching her slowly approach. Her shadowed face looked up at you, a young hand reaching through the bars and gently petting your fur, causing you to twitch and move back a little bit. She gasped quietly beneath her breath, her hand pulling away as she looked at you, two blue eyes glowing from the hood. Her cape dragged across the floor as she turned to the clerk again.

"I will take her, name your price" she announced firmly, catching the clerk off guard.

"A-Are you su-"

"Did I stutter sir?" she said coldly.

The man stepped back, a cold sweat coming off his face. "N-No of course mistress. Y-You can have her for two gold, d-does that seem fair?"

You saw her reach into her pocket, tossing a few gold coins to the floor, the metallic ringing through the room. "Keep the change, as a courtesy. Now, as for my slave...." She turned back to you, unlatching the cage and taking your arm, looking quite forceful but in reality very gently gripping your chains.

Without another word, you followed her out of the auction house, leaving a wordless clerk to collect his cash. As you came around to her carriage, she lifted you up into the back and joined you as it set off. Surprisingly, she undid your chains, the metal cuffs bouncing out of the wagon as she sat across from you, pulling back her hood to reveal her chestnut brown hair, flowing gently behind her as her soft face smiled warmly.

"I apologize for taking you as crudely as I did, but I'd hate to have raised any suspicions with those slave traders. Now, my name is Jessica, but you may call me whatever you wish. What is your name my dear?"

Completely dumbfounded by the sudden shift in tone, you could only look back at the woman for a few moments before finally speaking.
131221.title: See what this mistress has in store for you

1312211.content:
The wooden carriage bounced along the quiet woodland road as you looked as Jessica, her deep blue eyes looking at you with a warm wonder. You bit your lip for a moment, your cheeks turning rosy beneath the smudged dirt and grime.

"C-Celeste ma'am...." is all you could say as your eyes dropped to the wooden floor. Celeste, a name you hadn't heard from yourself or anyone for so long, even before you were captured. It hurt to remember the past, all the torment you had gone through just to survive by your lonesome....

Jessica's hand came to your chin, raising your head gently as she rubbed your cheek, feeling yet another matted piece of fur. "It's a beautiful name, perfect for such a beautiful fox like yourself. Please, if there is something you need to get off your chest, please say so. I will not hurt you, like those brutes."

You could feel your fur go up on end as she finished, memories of your year with them flooding back. You almost cried as tears welled up in the corners of your eyes, wiping them away as you cleared your throat. "I-I am sorry I...I just don't trust humans easily. It's been...very hard for me these last two years...." that's when the tears really came out, your heart pounding in your chest.

"Celeste..." she started again, taking your hands in her own, her tone becoming lighter and warmer. "I understand...I've met many of your kind and I know what my kind have done to you poor things. Once we get you home, I hope you'll feel...well, at home" she chuckled, rubbing the back of her head.

The rest of the trip was rather quiet as you listened to Jessica talking, only replying when you could get yourself to. Looking out the window, you found yourself on a dirt road, much smoother than the woodland paths you had traveled, trees lining either side as fields opened up past them. The carriage stopped alongside an old stone cottage, decorated with a variety of flowers. It looked almost brand new thanks to how well kept it was. As you followed Jessica out, you heard the driver drop down, none other than the cat you had seen only a few months ago. A young calico in her mid 20's, she stood almost a foot taller than you, a hand on her hip as she wiped away a little sweat

"Phew, hope the trip wasn't too bumpy for you two" she started. Quickly she noticed you, a little surprised. "Eh I know you, don't I?"

"Y-Yeah, I think so...Miss Jessica just purchased me" you mumbled, blushing a bit.

"So I do know you! Well, Gen is the name. You're in good hands with Jess here" she chuckled, turning to Jessica. "I'll go get the horses back to their stables ma'am and I'll get started on dinner for the four of us."

"Good good Gen. Thank you" she nodded, watching as Gen unhooked the horses and led them off toward the barn across the way. Jessica took your hand, leading you inside with a warm smile.

The inside was just as neatly decorated as she led you up the white stairs to the second floor, opening up the bathroom and leading you in. Two wooden stools sat off to the side inside the rather roomy bathroom, a large shower and bath and an assortment of cleaners and brushes all about. As you took a seat, she came over with a brush and scissors, sitting down behind you as she started to work your matted fur, humming gently to sooth you.

"You see Celeste, I am not like most slave owners. You and the everyone else here are my family, safe for as long as I'm here. I do have a farm, the slave dealers know that quite well, but I cannot ask of you to help just yet, not till you are more adjusted to our way of life" she cooed gently, very careful not to pull on your fur too hard. "I'm sorry if- oh dang, sorry , are you ok?" she asked, having pulled a little too hard, causing you to tense up and groan.

"Y-Yes ma'am....just a little sensitive, but...I've been through worst" you sigh, grabbing your arm, numb to the pain at this point.

Jessica didn't say anything more as she worked down your body, very careful now as to not hurt you. As the last knot was pulled out, she sighed, placing the tools away and coming around to you, helping you up. "I am very sorry my dear. Get yourself cleaned up while I get you a new outfit, alright?"

You nodded, not saying a word as you held your arm, shy and very nervous. As she left, you took the old rags the slave owners had put you in, tossing them straight into the garbage, climbing into the large bath. Warm water poured from the faucet as you stepped in, falling back into the warm waters all the way up to your neck. It felt so luxurious, the warm water surrounding your aching body as you grabbed some soap, slowly working over your body with no rush at all. Bubbles formed on the surface of the water as you finished, taking another few more moments as you almost fell asleep. Just as you got yourself out and dried, you heard a knock at the door, Jessica peeking in before entering, folded clothes in hand.

"My my Celeste, what beautiful fur you have. I think these should do you nicely, I'll just be outside when you're ready" she said softly, handing you them and closing the door behind her. Indeed the sleeveless black dress with a small skirt fit your thin body quite well, your crystal white fur and tail highlighting it greatly. As you stepped out, Jessica was waiting, turning from the adjacent wall and looking at you, sparkles in her eyes. "What do you think my dear, do you like it?"

"Yes ma'am, very much so" you replied softly, fixing the dress a bit as you looked yourself over, a small smile on your face for the first time.

Jessica noticed this, beaming a little as she hugged you "Come then, we can talk over some dinner."

With a small, more confident nod, you followed her back down the stairs toward the dining room.
1312211.title: Your first real home

13122111.content:
Following Jessica down the stairs, it was a quick turn toward the kitchen table in the next room, a lovely array of food spread over it, plates neatly put into place with silverware and napkins. However, as Jessica sat down, you noticed someone else, a pair of long ears hanging off the side of their brown hair, wearing a dress much like yourself. A family full of girls? You could definitely get used to that, you thought to yourself as you sat next to Jessica, staying close to her and looking over at the bunny again. Their face...it didn't seem right to you, although you couldn't quite place it.

Your thoughts were cut off as Gen, hands mittened as she carried platter in, set it down before the three of you, taking them off and sitting next to you, your long tails swishing into each other a few times.

"So everyone, as Celeste is a new member of the family, I would like to introduce ourselves" Jessica announced, folding her hands neatly. "As you know Celeste, I am Jessica, the human caretaker of this farm and, in a way, a mother of sorts for everyone here. Gen?"

The cat nodded, chuckling to herself "And you've met me, twice now! I take care of most of the hard work around here, including the horses and the fields. I'm happy to have a new sister around here! Mentioning that... Jackie, would you care to introduce yourself?"

Looking across from you, the rabbit's face blushed heavily, hiding behind their ears a bit as they drooped in front of their face. "I-I'm Jackie, as Gen said. I take care of the smaller animals as well as cleaning and everything" they said softly, peeking out from behind their ears before sighing, rubbing their sleeved arm shyly, looking at you with warm eyes. "It's every nice to meet you Celeste. M-Miss Jessica, w-will she be staying with me then? I... I don't mind but..." they drooped down a bit, flustered.

"Easy Jackie. I'm sure you'll be fine with Celeste, she's a very nice fox after all" Jessica said gently, in the most motherly voice you had heard in forever.

You looked around at the three, your heart pounding in your chest. This was going to be your family..." T-Thank you all for having me! I.... I know I'm new around here but...I'll do my best as part of this great family!" you said suddenly, covering your mouth as your face went bright red, overcome by the shock that you said all that.

You felt Gen's hand give you a firm pat on the back, hearing her laughing. "That's the spirit Celeste! I knew you were my type of girl!"

Suddenly, you heard your stomach growl, blushing a little. "M-May we eat now Miss Jessica?"

The human eyes beamed as she nodded encouragingly "Of course! Please, let's all dig in to this feast Gen made us."

"Oh Jessica, I'm humbled" Gen chuckled, rubbing the back of her head.

With introductions over, first came the food. Cornbread, potatoes, ham, and eggs laid out among the vast varieties of food among the four of you, eager but polite hands taking some at a time, the glass dishes filling up quickly as the feast began. As you ate some of the cornbread and ham, you could feel your hungry belly filling slowly, a feeling you had not felt in forever. It was all so good, so fresh and filling. You could see everyone else at their meals too. Gen was rather ravenous with her dish, hungry from a long day of work outside. Jackie on the other hand only picked at the foods, eating slowly much like Jessica. In one day you went from being a caged animal to being a part of a family. It was almost a dream come true for you.

As the platters slowly emptied and everyone finished the last of their food, you saw Gen coming around, collecting the plates and silverware and taking them all to the kitchen, Jackie joining her to help clean them. Jessica on the other hand moved closer to you, placing a hand on your lap. "So Celeste, how was your meal?"

"I-It was quite good Miss Jessica. I've...never had something so good in such a long time. If I may ask...is there something I'm missing with Jackie? She doesn't seem that enthused about me staying with her."

"Ah. Well... Jackie is a bit shy if you hadn't noticed and...just ask her tonight about themselves. You'll understand when she tells you." She gently leaned forward, patting your head gently. "I'm glad you enjoyed your dinner. Tomorrow I'll show you around the farm, for now just head upstairs to the room. It's next to the bathroom, that's where you'll be staying. My room is at the end of the hall if you need me, alright?"

"Yes ma'am. Thank you....ever so much!" you leaned forward hugging her warmly, feeling her hands wrap around you as she nuzzled her head against your shoulder. "Sleep good, I'll see you at dawn" you purred, pulling away and nodding before heading up the stairs.

As you opened the door, it was quite obvious why you were staying in there, two beds on either side of the room across from each other. Each had identical dressers, desks, and closets on their respective sides, a look inside the closet revealing many more dresses and a nightgown, so perfectly hung for you. With Jackie busy, you were able to change into the nightgown and look around a bit more before you heard the creak of the door, the light brown haired rabbit coming in, blushing heavily.
13122111.title: Dinner with the Family

131221111.content:
As the young bunny, probably a year or two younger than you, entered the room, their eyes looked everywhere except were you were on your side of the room. Their ears drooped as they headed toward their bed, seeing them peek over at you a few times before turning away, huddling away on their side of the room.

For a little bit, you minded yourself, looking around in the drawers and occasionally take a second to look over at the bunny, sitting at their desk seeming to scribble notes or something in their book. As a naturally quiet hunter, you snuck your way across the room, peeking over their shoulder curiously. It was a diary of all things, their shaky hand writing about their day. Suddenly, the two bunny ears perked up, bouncing off your chin. Caught off guard, the bunny's head turned to look back, only to lose their balance.

"W-Whoa wha-?" they let out, very surprised as they wobbled in the chair, almost falling off. They brushed their hair back as they readjusted themselves, looking at you closely. "C-C-Celeste?! W-What were you...d-doing behind me like that?!"

A heavy blush covered your face, your eager tail now between your legs. "W-Well....Miss Jessica told me to ask you about....yourself. I couldn't help but notice you were...a bit worried about sharing a room with me at dinner. I'd just like to know why" you let out gently, sighing as you rubbed the back of your head. "Sorry for scaring you, I just didn't want to interrupt."

They blinked a few times, their eyes as wide as they could be in fear. Then, they sighed, their ears drooping even more as they lowered their chin. "Celeste...I...I...." they stuttered, their eyes tearing up in the corners of their face. Then, they felt your warm embrace as you came around, hugging them gently and keeping your head close as you listened, nodding firmly. They looked a little surprised, but nodded gently. "Celeste...I'm not like you. I'm...a boy...." he sighed, the tears in the corner of his eyes running down his face as the water works slowly opened, a gentle stream running down his face. He clung tightly to you, whimpering a little.

It all made sense now, the odd look of his face and all of it. But...all you could do was think of this poor, crying boy hugging you tightly in your arms. You gently pet his head, humming with a gentle purr in your voice as you tried to sooth him.

Eventually, you felt his grip on you growing weaker, his crying turning into little sobs as he sat up, wiping the tears from his blurry eyes. His head still pointed downward, whimpering quietly. "I...I didn't mean to lie to you but....while I am a boy I've always acted like a girl. I mean, this dress..." he fluffed the bottom of it, sighing gently "it just feels right to me...but when I let slip how I felt...many of my friends turned on me, beat me up and....one even tried to eat me...." He whimpered some more, your gentle touch to his shoulder calming him down a little more. "That friend...was a fox like you, so...it's a little hard not to remember it...but...you're different. You're so kind and...I don't know...Miss Jessica and Gen know but...I've never felt right talking to them all about...this..."

As you listened to the boy's sad tale, you could only find yourself more and more taken aback by shock and yet also understanding his pain. While you didn't go through what he did, growing up as a girl wasn't easy for you either, having been bullied many times due to your size and perceived weakness. As he finished, your hand came up to his cheek, rubbing it gently as you looked at him warmly. "I understand Jackie...I promise, I will never eat one of my family, especially you. If I may...I could help you. We are sharing the same room so...it's not exactly hard for us to have some privacy. But only if you want me to, I understand if you ca-"

You were suddenly cut off as you felt him practically leap into you, hugging you tightly. "I...I...I'd really appreciate that. Thank you...for understanding. I think I can...put the past behind me...for you" he said gently, his teary eyes clearing as he looked up to you, his amber eyes staring into yours. "I...I think it's time we head to bed. We can talk about this more tomorrow....thank you." He slowly pulled back, nodding gently as he rested his arms atop his legs, smiling for the first time.

"You're more than welcome Jackie. Here let me just..." you reached for his hair, curling it with your claw back into position "there we go, can't have my new friend all messy before he goes to bed" you winked, standing up with him. "I hope you sleep better now that we....figured this all out. I'll just-"

"Wait!" he cried out, grabbing your hand stop you. "C-Can we...sleep together? Rabbits tend to sleep near each other and..." he trailed off, blushing a little.

"I understand. Of course Jackie" you giggled, turning back to him and taking his hands in your own. As the young bunny crawled up in the bed, he watched you very closely as you followed. A heavy draft blew through the window, causing the bunny to shiver. With your usually warm body, an idea quickly formed in your head, laying beside him and hugging him against you, wrapping your tail over his body.

He yelped a little, eyes opening wide before relaxing again, nuzzling closer to you. "Thank you Celeste...you must be an angel to have come here" he giggled. "Goodnight sister...sleep...good..." he yawned, his body naturally curling up against you as he quickly fell asleep. Poor thing, he was so tuckered out he barely said goodnight.

You kiss his head gently, curling your body around his in your warmth. It was....rather soothing to be honest. You remembered how your mom would do this when you were younger. It seemed you had turned into a something similar, a caring sister that wanted to protect your little bunny brother. With a warm smile on your face, you slowly drifted to sleep, your first real slumber in forever.....
131221111.title: The Truth About Jackie (Reserved)

"Dr. Matthews?" A leopard, dressed in a tight blouse and chic black pencil skirt addressed the labcoat donned gray wolf, giving the beast above the good doctor a fearful glance.
         "Yes?" Dr. Matthews, (Greyfur Matthews, though he despised his first name) responded, not taking his eyes off his work.
         "Serena... The fox from Bionic Enhancements... she wants to speak with you. She says they've made... a breakthrough?"
         "Ah... Yes." He pushed his glasses further up his nose and shuffled through a stack of papers. "I'll make sure to contact her." Dr. Matthews returned his attention to the experiment.
         "What... What is that thing...?" Alia, the curvy leopard secretary asked as her gaze travelled up the behemoth's frame. It was... ugly, to say the least. Mostly hairless, save for a frazzled brown mane coming from its head. It bore a bit of a resemblance to an ape, though it did not share the prehensile thumb on its feet. Currently the beast was forced to kneel before its captors, its wrists locked in place by heavy cuffs attached to chains, both forged from titanium. It's head hung low, shrouding its face with its hair. Its crazed brown eyes glinted beneath its mane and its lips parted to bare its feral teeth. Alia rapidly stepped back in horror. Dr. Matthews, standing confidently beside it, was no taller than its middle finger.
         "Don't worry, Alia." Dr. Matthews reassured her. "She can't hurt you." He flipped through a notebook filled with chickenscratch along with various diagrams, "They seem to be called hu-mans... odd name..."
         "A-Are you sure?" Alia asked, nervously eyeing the strained metal chains. They could snap at any moment... she thought.
         "Of course I am." He replied. Alia jumped as the beast flexed its wrists, a horrible metallic creak echoing through the room. The thing laughed a bit as it flexed again, pulling the chains from their supports in the floor. She was free. Finally free. The chains swung wildly as an enormous hand came down, knocking Alia and Dr. Matthews backwards. Alia screamed in terror. Surely death was upon them, she thought, as the monster's gaze tracked the pair's every movement...
